loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Sherley requested a PHP 12,000 (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to buy meat, rice, vegetables, spices, noodles, seasonings, etc. for her business.

In the future, Sherley would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, spices, noodles, seasonings, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Lolie has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 35 years old and married with four children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vitaliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like bread, laundry soap, milk, coffee, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Vitaliana has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, laundry soap, milk, coffee, shampoo, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Vitaliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like bread, laundry soap, milk, coffee, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store

In the future, Hyna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

texts.en:
Telesfora is 62 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Telesfora runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, such as chips, bread, egg, noodles, can goods, etc.

Telesfora has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Telesfora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as chips, bread, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Virginia has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed,

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 38 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for her children.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase items like snack foods, eggs, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like snack foods, eggs, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell. Vergie has been in this business for twelve years.

Vergie would like to to save enough money for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is 37 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her child.

Jhona runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soaps, candies, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Jhona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soaps, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a 36-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for one year, and also earns income from selling frozen foods and providing videoke (entertainment) rentals.

Having received and repaid a previous loan from NWTF, Alma has requested a new one for PHP 5000 to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Socrates works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Socrates is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, eggs, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Socrates has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, eggs, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business. Nida has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her family. Clarita is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Clarita  has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Estrelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Estrelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Estrelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Evelyn earns more income from pig fattening and rice farming.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Fely Rose

texts.en:
Fely Rose is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living through buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines. Fely Rose is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Fely Rose has been buying and selling charcoal for 7 years, and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 62 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Herminia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries for harvesting her sugarcane.

Herminia has been farming sugarcane for one year, and earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries for harvesting her sugarcane.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old and has eight children. Lourdes is married and one of her children is in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her hogs.

Lourdes has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Roseny

texts.en:
Roseny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Roseny has been in this business for 20 years. Roseny earns more income from a general store and vegetable farming.

Roseny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

Ruth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Ruth has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling beauty products.

Ruth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Anecita is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional items such as fabric, thread and a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like fabric, thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ellen

Ellen is 38 years old and married with five children.

Ellen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ellen has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Ellen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Elvira

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, milk, soap, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut and raising livestock.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:

Juliet has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her motorcycle transport business.

Juliet has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Flocerfida has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline and rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Leonora

Leonora has been in this business for four years.  She also earns income from raising pigs.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

Lizelda has been in this business for four years now and she earns additional income from pig-fattening.

In the future, Lizelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending and raising pigs.

Junay has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Maria Theresa has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from a buy-and-sell rice grains business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

texts.en:
Carmela is 67 years old and married with five children. Carmela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile phone credits. 

Carmela has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stock, like sugar, coffee, milk, soap, and shampoo. Carmela has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Carmela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, like sugar, coffee, milk, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old and married with six children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling bamboo.

Editha aspires to save enough money so she could buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 53 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

Nida has been farming vegetables for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of food to sell for her food vending business.

Alona has been in this business for three years. Alona earns more income from raising pigs.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of food to sell

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 33 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emely has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Emely is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items for her general store business, like soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

Catalina successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Catalina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice-retailing. Elsa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 64 years old, married, and she has eight children. 

Estrella is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for 24 years now, and she has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 54 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines; she has been doing this for 17 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Elsie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Noida

texts.en:
Mary Noida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Mary Noida earns additional income from farming rice.

Mary Noida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nora

texts.en:
Ma. Nora is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Four of her children are in school. Ma. Nora is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for ten years.

Ma. Nora requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 31 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Herminia has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Herminia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 56 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

Ofelia has been farming rice  for ten years and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell dried fish business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She works in the agricultural industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Michelle requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Michelle would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Milagros works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  

Milagros is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. Milagros hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pingky

texts.en:
Pingky is 60 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Pingky has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft-drinks, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Pingky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 62 years old and married with seven children. Rosalia works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is a 76-year-old widow with eight children.

Salud works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salud has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Salud aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married, with five children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Violeta has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 58 years old, married, and has nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virgilia has a coffee shop business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials and new utensils for her coffee shop. Virgilia has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Virgilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new utensils for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising chickens. Elsie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old and married, with six children. With five children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as eggs, canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maylin works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig-fattening. Maylin is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

Maylin has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 37 years old and married with one child.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elvie has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling fruit.

Elvie aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruit.  Editha is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more items like bags, blankets and other dry goods to offer for sale.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bags, blankets and other dry goods to offer for sale.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ella works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish-vending. Ella is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Ella has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Roselyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 52 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rowena has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosaluz

texts.en:
Rosaluz is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosaluz is 42 years old and both of her children are in school.

Rosaluz has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosaluz requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosaluz has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Rosaluz would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marecel

texts.en:
Marecel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks to sell to her customers.

Marecel has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from a restaurant.

Marecel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her frozen food business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an oyster culture business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for seven years and earns additional income from selling fish.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binders, fishing nets and other equipment for her oyster culture business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders, fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Shovy

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Shovy works hard to support her family.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a tricycle transportation business and a general store.  

Shovy is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Shovy has been sustaining her business activities through her previous four loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 59 years old.  She is married and has five children.

Bernadita works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Prior to requesting this loan, Bernadita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Bernadita aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jessica is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Norlie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Norlie works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Norlie is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to  purchase more vegetables to sell to her nearest community.

Norlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 57 years old and married with six children.

Merilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Merilyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Mamerta works hard to support her family. She has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. Mamerta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Mamerta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rachel works hard to support her family. She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Rachel is borrowing PHP 50,000, through NWTF, in order to buy crude oil and new equipment.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business and have a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and new equipment for her rice milling.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 47 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rona has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a back-up light in case of emergency.

Mary Joy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a business making and selling candy in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients for her candies.

Annabelle has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her candies.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support 3 children. She is a widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Thelma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candy making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy making business.

Ma. Erma successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Erma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy making.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 33 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ednalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ednalyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, shampoo, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Ednalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Magela

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Magela works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like slippers, pants, bags and other school supplies.

Magela has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like slippers, pants, bags and other school supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a dry-goods business in the Philippines. Magdalena is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear items to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including pants, blouses, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling recycled materials. Nelinda is borrowing  29,000 PHP to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es: Flor es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil donde ella vende cangrejos.  Ha trabajado en esta actividad desde muy pequeña, debido a que se trata de un negocio familiar.  Trabaja sola todos los días desde temprano en la mañana.  Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, todos menores de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro le gustaría poder seguir trabajando duro para darle lo mejor a su familia.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para hacer un mejoramiento en su casa.
texts.en:
Flor is from the Guasmo sector of Guayaquil, where she sells crabs.  She has been in this line of work from a very young age since it has been a family business.  Flor works alone every day, starting in the early morning hours.  She is a single mother and has three young children, all of whom attend a state school in the area.  In the future, she would like to continue working hard so that she can provide the best for her family.

For now, Flor needs a loan so that she can make an improvement to her house.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Olivia Magdalena

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Aprendió a cocinar con su mamá, luego trabajó en un restaurante y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo tiene su negocio propio.  Trabaja sola los fines de semana, cerca de su casa, con su carreta de comidas rápidas.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  Le gustaría en un futuro poder tener su propio restaurante, mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.  Por ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para mejorar su vivienda y su carreta del negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Guasmo sector of Guayaquíl.  She learned to cook with her mother and later worked at restaurant.  Thanks to her effort, she now has her own business.  The borrower works alone on the weekends near her house from a fast food cart.  She is a single mother and has two young children who are attending a state school in their neighborhood.  In the future she would like to have her own restaurant, improve her income, and help her family move forward.  

For now, the borrower needs the money from this loan to improve her home and the cart for her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her food cart and to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Ligia Victoria

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó 13 años atrás cuando su anterior esposo le dio una cantidad de dinero para que lo invierta en alguna actividad.  Fue entonces que decidió montar una pequeña tienda, con la cual ha trabajado hasta ahora.  Trabaja con su hijo, desde las 7 am hasta las 10 pm, todos los días.  No es casada y tiene hijos, pero ya son todos mayores de edad.  Desea a futuro, poder seguir trabajando duro en su negocio y construir 2 depósitos para alquilarlos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de artículos de bazar y abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídes area of Guayaquil.  She started 13 years ago when her former husband gave her some money to invest in some business activity.  That was when she decided to set up a small store with which she has worked to date.

She works with her son from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day.  She is not married.  She has children, but all of them are grown.

In the future she wishes to be able to continue working hard in her business and to build two warehouses to rent out.

She now needs the loan to buy miscellaneous items and groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Jenny Marilu

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó con este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, debido a que siempre le ha gustado la cocina y tiene buena sazón.  Trabaja todos los días, inclusive los fines de semana y feriados de 4 am hasta 12 pm.  Es casada y su esposo es empleado en una compañía.  En un futuro, desea seguir arreglando su casa y comprar un congelador para su negocio.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de abarrotes necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídes area of Guayaquil.  She started with this business a long time ago because she has always liked cooking and she has a way with seasoning.

She works every day, including week-ends and holidays, from 4:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

She is married, and her husband works for a company.

In the future she wishes to continue fixing her house and to buy a freezer for her business.

She now needs the loan to buy the groceries needed to prepare the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old and he lives in Kapan city with his mother. Edgar, after returning from the army, works at the Copper Molybdenum Combine as a locksmith. Edgar’s life turned to be very hard and tiring; his father died last year, Edgar’s mother is seriously sick and she is not able to take care of herself. The difficulties are so many that Edgar can do nothing, but to be patient in order to be able to overcome these barriers that the life has prepared for him and his family.
Edgar’s salary is very small and he asks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to finish the work of his father’s burial site(including a gravestone).

loans.use: to finish the work of his father’s burial site.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 54 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

Salvacion farms rice in the Philippines and has requested a 35,000 PHP loan to buy more  rice to sell. She has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to give financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 38 years old and married with four children who are all in school. Olivia works very hard to provide for them.

Olivia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Olivia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Olivia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married mother of 10 children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from clothing sales.  Leonila is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling feeds business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of feeds to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of feeds to sell.

loans.name: Mariquez

texts.en:
Mariquez is 44 years old and widowed, with three children.

Mariquez works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Mariquez has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and she also earns an income from raising chickens.

Mariquez aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 37 years old and married, with four children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, shampoo, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma.Victoria is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma.Victoria has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines. Ma.Victoria requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

Ma.Victoria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ma.Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Waling-Waling

texts.en:
Waling-Waling is 49 years old and married with six children.

Waling-Waling works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Waling-Waling has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Waling-Waling aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresa María

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició en la actividad de venta de cosméticos, debido a que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y las ventas, pero sobretodo, por llevar un ingreso a su hogar.  Trabaja todos los días sola, variando su horario dependiendo de los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.  Es casada y su esposo es maestro albañil.  Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, quienes estudian en el colegio fiscal del área donde viven.  Desea a futuro poder arreglar su casa, incrementar su negocio y ver que sus hijos terminen sus carreras universitarias.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para la adecuación de su vivienda.
texts.en: This borrower is from the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She started her business selling cosmetics because she had always enjoyed commerce and sales, and most of all, to bring an income to her household.  She works on her own every day, varying her schedule according to the orders that her customers make.  She is married, and her husband is a construction supervisor.  She has 3 minor children who attend the public school in the area where they live.  In the future, she would like to fix up her house, expand her business, and see her children finish their university degrees.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy construction materials to make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició con esta actividad debido a que siempre le han gustado las ventas y tuvo la oportunidad de realizarla.  Esto también le ayudó a dedicarle tiempo de atender a una persona que padece una condición física.  Trabaja todos los días sola, dede las 8 am hasta las 9 pm.  No es casada, pero tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, quienes van al colegio fiscal de su barrio.  A futuro, le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y levantar otro piso.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de artículos de bazar para su venta.
texts.en: This borrower is from the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She started her store because she had always enjoyed selling, and she had the opportunity to start a business.  This also helped her to devote time to taking care of a person who suffers from a medical condition.  She works every day on her own from 8am until 9pm.  She is not married, but she has 3 minor children who attend the public school in her neighborhood.  In the future, she would like to improve her house and put in a new floor.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy general merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Maryuri

texts.es: La cliente reside en el área de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Decidió emprender en la venta de cosméticos debido a que deseaba parar más tiempo con sus hijos.  Trabaja todos los días sola, en diversos horarios, dependiendo del recorrido que realice para la venta de sus productos.  No es casada, pero tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea a futuro ponerle baldosas y también levantar otra loza en su casa.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de artículos de belleza y productos naturales para su comercialización.
texts.en: Maryuri lives in the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She decided to start a business selling cosmetics because she wanted to spend more time with her children.  She works on her own every day on a schedule that varies according to route that she takes to sell her products.  Maryuri is not married, but she has 3 children who attend the local public school.  In the future, she would like to put a new slab in her home and put in a tile floor.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy beauty products and natural products for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquideas en Guayaquil.  Decidió tiempo atrás trabajar de aprendiz, ayudando en un gabinete de belleza.  Pronto se adiestró en esta actividad y pudo montar su propio gabinete, donde hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.  Trabaja sola todos los días, desde las 8 am hasta las 9 pm.  No es casada, pero tiene un hijo menor de edad, que estudia en un colegio fiscal.  Desea a futuro construir otro departamento y también comprarse un vehículo.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de implementos para uso de su salón de belleza.
texts.en: Martha is from the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She decided some time ago to work as an apprentice, helping out in a beauty salon.  Soon she became skilled in this activity, and she was able to establish her own salon.  So far, the business has done very well.  She works on her own every day from 8am until 9pm.  She is not married, but she has a minor child who attends the local public school.  In the future, she wants to build another apartment and also buy herself a vehicle.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy equipment for use in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies and items for her beauty salon

loans.name: Miguel Enrique

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició tiempo atrás como aprendiz en el negocio del aluminio y vidrio, posteriormente se especializó y pudo montar su propio negocio.  Trabaja todos los días en su taller, de 8 am hasta 7 pm.  No es casado y no tine hijos.  En un futuro, le gustaría poder comprar una casa e incrementar su negocio mucho más.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo e insumos.
texts.en: The client is from the Orquídeas area of Guayaquil.  He began some time ago as an apprentice in the glass and aluminum business. Subsequently he specialized and was able to set up his own business. He works every day in his workshop from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.  He is not married and does not have children. Someday he would like to be able to buy a house and increase his business considerably. Now he needs the loan for the purchase of work materials and supplies.

loans.use: To buy work materials.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es: El cliente vive en el área de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició tiempo atrás en la actividad de las comunicaciones, cuando su cuñado lo llevó a trabajar en una empresa relacionada y donde aprendió todo lo que sabe acerca de tecnología.  Trabaja todos los días, de acuerdo a los contratos que le presentan, en diferentes horarios.  Es casado y su esposa trabaja en un comisariato.  Tiene un hijo, menor de edad que estudia en una escuela particular.  Desea a futuro poder comprarse una casa, incrementar su negocio y comprar un vehículo para viajar a diferentes lugares.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídeas area of Guayaquil.  He started in the communications business some time ago, when his brother-in-law brought him in to work at a company in this field, where he learned everything he knows about technology. He works every day according to the contracts that come up and his hours vary. 

He is married and his wife works in an office. He has a minor child who studies at a private school. In the future he wishes to be able to buy himself a house, to increase his business and buy a car for traveling various places. Now he needs the loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Francisco Rigoberto

texts.es: El cliente vive en el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Decidió involucrarse en esta actividad debido a que deseaba ser su propio gerente y manejar su negocio por cuenta propia.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 10 pm.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos que son menores de edad y estudian en instituciones fiscales.  A futuro desea ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios e incrementar su negocio significativamente.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de billetes de lotería para su venta.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídeas area of Guayaquil. He decided to get involved in this business because he wished to be his own boss and be self-employed. He works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.

He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has three children who are minors and go to public schools. Someday he wishes to see his children finish their studies and to increase his business significantly. Now he needs a loan in order to purchase lottery tickets to sell.

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets to sell.

loans.name: Maricela Esther

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició con la actividad de venta de cosméticos debido a que necesitaba tener más tiempo para sus hijos y además le gusta mucho el negocio de las ventas.  Trabaja sola todos los días, en diferentes horarios durante la mañana y tarde.  Es casada y su esposo es empleado en una empresa.  Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad y estudian en instituciones fiscales.  Desea a futuro poder arreglar su casa, comprar un carro y darle la educación a sus hijos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para las adecuaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The client is from the Orquídeas area of Guayaquil. She started in the business of selling cosmetics because she needed to have more time for her children; and besides she really likes the sales business. She works alone every day, for varying hours during the morning and afternoon. 

She is married and her husband is an employee at a company. She has three minor children who go to public schools. Someday she wishes to be able to fix her house, buy a car, and provide an education for her children. Now she needs a loan to buy construction materials for the improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sonnia Azucena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Decidió iniciar el negocio de venta de ropa debido a que, según su criterio, era un medio muy común para generar ingresos, por motivo de que la gente siempre adquiere ropa con frecuencia.  Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas y tardes.  Es soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en la institución fiscal.  A futuro desea aumentar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She decided to start her business selling clothing, because in her judgment, it was a very common way to generate income; for the reason that people always buy clothing and do so often. She works every day, in the mornings and afternoons. 

She is single and has a son who goes to public school. Someday she wishes to expand her clientele and improve her income. Now she needs a loan to buy clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dorys Patricia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició vendiendo con su hermana, pero luego decidió independizarse y hasta ahora le ha resultado productiva esta actividad.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo de 8 am a 9 pm y labora por su cuenta haciendo sus recorridos.  No es casada y sus hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea a futuro poner un local en su domicilio y seguir trabajando duro.  Ahora necesita invertir el crédito en la compra de blusas, camisas y pantalonetas para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started selling with her sister, but later decided to go out on her own, and so far this business has been profitable for her. She works from Monday to Sunday from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., and works on her own account, making her rounds. 

She is not married and her children go to public school in the area. Someday she wishes to set up a shop in her home and keep working hard. Now she needs to use the loan to purchase blouses, shirts and shorts to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jessica Veronica

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Tiempo atrás inició vendiendo ropa con su mamá, para luego independizarse y emprender por su propia cuenta, debido a que ya conocía el negocio y tenía sus propios clientes.  Trabaja sola, de lunes a sábado, de 9 am a 6 pm.  Es casada y sus esposo es albañil y electricista.  No tiene hijos y a futuro le gustaría tener un local para vender ropa y artículos de bazar.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y ropa interior.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  Some time ago she started selling clothes with her mother.  She later became independent and undertook working on her own because she then knew the business and had her own customers.

She works alone from Mondays through Saturdays from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer and electrician.  She does not have children.

In the future she would like to have a place to sell clothes and miscellaneous items.  She now needs the loan to buy blouses, pants, and underwear.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Francisca De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad vendiendo ropa bajo pedido y hasta ahora le ha resultado muy provechoso.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, especialmente durante la mañana.  Es casado y tiene hijos.  Le gustaría en un futuro poder tener su propia boutique, para continuar trabajando duro.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de más ropa para su venta.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started this business activity selling clothes by order.  So far it is been very profitable for her.  She works alone every day, especially during the morning.

She is married and has children.  In the future she would like to be able to have her own boutique in order to continue working hard.  

She now needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Miryam Iralda

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando sus padres le enseñaron todo acerca del negocio de la venta de ropa, desde entonces le ha resultado una actividad muy productiva.  Trabaja todos los días sola, particularmente en la mañana.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra en construcciones.  Desea a futuro poder incrementar su negocio de gran manera para darle todo a su familia.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de más ropa para su venta.
texts.en: This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  She started her clothing business some time ago after her parents taught her everything about the business.  Ever since, she has had a very productive business.  She works on her own each day, especially in the mornings.  She is married, and her husband works as a construction supervisor.  In the future, she wants to expand her business greatly so that she can give everything to her family.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Juana Angela

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta de comida rápida, pero luego decidió implementar el negocio de ropa.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado, todos los días, de 10 am a 8 pm.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil.  Tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.  Desea a futuro poder tener su local propio y también un bazar.  Ahora desea el crédito para la compra de ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en: This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  A while back, she started selling fast food, but later she decided to start a clothing business.  She works Monday through Saturday all day long, from 10am until 8pm.  She is married, and her husband works in construction.  She has children, but they are already grown.  In the future, she wants to have her own shop and also a general store.  At this time, she wants a loan to buy clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicente Francisco

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Su padre le enseño todo lo referente a la profesión de técnico en reparación de electrodomésticos, y luego lo convirtió en su principal fuente de ingresos.  Trabaja todos los días, de 10 am a 8 pm.  Es casado y su esposa se desempeña como ama de casa.  Tiene hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad.  Desea a futuro poder tener un local propio donde pueda atender a sus clientes y ofrecer más servicios.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo y repuestos para su labor diaria.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  His father taught him everything related to the profession of small appliance repairperson, and later he made it into his main source of income. He works every day from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. 

He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has children, but all are now adults. Someday he wishes to be able to have his own shop, where he can serve his customers and offer more services. Now he needs the loan to buy work tools and parts for his daily work.

loans.use: To buy tools and parts.

loans.name: Mónica Isabel

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó en el negocio de la venta de ropa trabajando con su hermano y luego ya emprendió por su cuenta propia.  Trabaja sola cuando sale del trabajo por las tardes, todos los días.  No es casada, pero tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea en un futuro poder terminar de construir su casa.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de pantalones, interiores y demás ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the city of Libertad.  She established a clothing sales business with her brother, but she later began working on her own.  The borrower works alone every day when she goes out to make sales in the afternoons.  She is not married, but she has two children who attend a state school in her neighborhood.  In the future, she wants to finish the construction of her house.

For now the borrower needs the money from this loan in order to buy trousers, undergarments, and other types of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy trousers, undergarments, and other types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó trabajando con su padre, quien le enseñó todo lo que tiene que ver con la actividad de la pesca.  El labora en las embarcaciones que salen hacia alta mar cada 3 meses para emprender con la pesca.  No es casado y no tiene hijos.  Desea a futuro seguir con su negocio, hacerlo crecer mucho más y superarse profesionalmente.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de implementos necesarios para su labor.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  He started working with his father, who taught him everything that has to do with the business activity of fishing.  He works on the boats that leave for the high seas every three months in order to begin fishing.  He is not married, and he has no children.

In the future he wishes to continue with his business, to make it grow a lot more, and to excel professionally.  He now needs the loan to buy the implements needed for his work.

loans.use: to buy items for fishing.

loans.name: Fátima Mercedes

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Estableció su tienda tiempo atrás, debido a que la consideró una oportunidad de ingresos al ver que no había ninguna en su sector.  Trabaja sola, todo el día desde temprano en la mañana.  No es casada, tiene un hijo menor de edad que aún no estudia.  Desea en un futuro poder incrementar su tienda y laborar duro para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo.  Ahora desea invertir el crédito en la compra de arroz, gaseosas y snacks para su venta.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She established her store some time ago.  She did this because, upon seeing that there were no others in the area, she considered it to be an income opportunity.

She works alone all day starting early in the morning.  She is not married.  She has a minor child who is not yet school age.  In the future she wishes to be able to augment her store and work hard in order to give her son everything he needs.

She now wishes to use the loan to buy rice, soft drinks, and snacks to sell.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Gladys Isabel

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó trabajando en la venta de calzado de manera ambulante, para luego alquilar un local y comercializar su producto más formalmente.  Trabaja sola, de lunes a domingo, de 9 am a 7 pm.  No es casada y tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro, le gustaría poder alquilar otro local o hacerlos propios.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de zapatos casuales y deportivos.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started working by selling shoes in an itinerant manner.  She then rented a place to sell her product more formally.

She works alone from Mondays through Sundays from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She is not married.  She has a child who attends public school in her area.

In the future she would like to be able to rent another place or to make them her own.  She now needs the loan to buy casual and athletic shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Margareth Desireth

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con su negocio con la ayuda de sus padres, quienes le brindaron el apoyo económico necesario, a fin de que pueda solventar sus gastos universitarios.  Fue entonces que escogió montar su tienda y hasta ahora le ha resultado muy productivo.  Además le permite pasar más tiempo en su casa y realizar sus labores de estudiante.  Trabaja todos los días, de 7 am a 7 pm.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos por el momento.  Quisiera poder alcanzar su título universitario en administración de empresas y poder ampliar su negocio con otro tipo de mercadería.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite y atún.
texts.en: This borrower is from the City of Libertad.  She started her business with the help of her parents, who provided her with the financial support that she needed so that she could pay for her university expenses.  She chose to start up a store, and up until now it's been very productive. Also, it enables her to spend more time at home and to have more time to devote to her studies.  She works every day from 7am until 7pm.  She is single and has no children at this time.  She would like to earn a degree in business administration, and also expand her business with more types of merchandise.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, cooking oil and tuna.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad, trabajando con su esposo y recorriendo los sectores cercanos a donde habitan.  Trabaja junto a él, todos los días, particularmente en las tardes.  Su esposo también ejerce como albañil cuando no está con ella.  Tiene un hijo quien va a la escuela fiscal.  A futuro le gustaría terminar la construcción de su casa.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de pantalones, blusas y ropa interior para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Libertad.  She started with this business activity by working with her husband and traveling to the areas close to where they live.  She works with him every day, particularly in the afternoons.  Her husband also works as a bricklayer when he is not with her.  She has a son who goes to the public school.

In the future she would like to finish building her house.  

She now needs the loan to buy pants, blouses, and underwear to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Patricia Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó a vender algunos productos en su casa y como le fue bien, aumentó su mercadería con otros artículos de primera necesidad.  Labora todos los días, desde su casa.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en su carro.  Tiene un hijo menor de edad que estudia en la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  Le gustaría en un futuro poder tener su propio local en el centro de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos para su venta.
texts.en: This borrower is from the City of Libertad. She started her business selling products from her home, and since it went well, she increased her merchandise with other staple consumer goods.  She works every day from her home.  She is married, and her husband works with his car.  She has a minor child who attends the local public school.  In the future, she would like to have her own store in the center of the city.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and other products for her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: César Enrique

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Aprendió el negocio de su hermano mayor, como ayudante hasta cumplir con su meta de tener su taller automotriz propio.  Trabaja solo de 8 am a 6 pm,.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos por el momento.  A futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su taller e integrar tecnología de punta a su trabajo.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de pintura, electrodos y masilla, necesarios para su labor diaria.
texts.en: Cesar is from the City of Libertad.  He learned this business from his older brother, working as an assistant until he could accomplish his goal of having his own auto body workshop.  He works alone from 8am until 6pm.  He is single, and at this time he has no children.  In the future, he would like to expand his workshop and incorporate the latest technology in his work.  At this time, he needs a loan to buy paint, electrodes and auto body filler, items he needs for his daily work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for his business

loans.name: Eddy Ramón

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó vendiendo gafas en la playa de Salinas, luego empezó con la venta de abarrotes en su casa.  Posteriormente compró más mercadería para incrementar su negocio.  Trabaja todos los días con su esposa, desde temprano en la mañana.  Cuando sale a vender gafas, su esposa se queda a cargo de la tienda.  Tiene hijos menores que van a la escuela  fiscal de su sector.  A futuro, desea tener su propio local, en el centro de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, legumbres y otros productos para su comercialización.
texts.en: Eddy is from the City of Libertad.  He started out selling sunglasses on the beach in Salinas, and later started a business selling groceries from his house.  Subsequently, he bought more merchandise to expand his business.  He works every day with his wife, starting in the early hours of the morning.  When he goes out to sell sunglasses, his wife stays to tend to the store.  Eddy has minor children who attend the local public school.  In the future, he wants to have his own store in the center of the city.  At this time, he needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, vegetables, and other products for his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store

loans.name: Maricela Anabel

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con el comercio de ropa tiempo atrás, vendiéndole principalmente a sus amigos, vecinos y conocidos.  Trabaja sola, recorriendo varios sectores para comercializar sus prendas.  No es casada, pero tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en escuela particular.
