Desea a futuro seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para incrementarlo y darle todo a su familia.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y faldas para su venta.
texts.en: Maricela is from the City of Libertad.  She started her business selling clothing some time ago, selling mainly to her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances.  She works alone, going about the various neighborhoods to sell her garments.  She is not married, but she has 2 children who attend public school.  In the future, she wants to continue to invest in her business to expand it so that she can give everything to her family.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy blouses, pants, and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó con un dinero que le regaló su hijo, con el cual pudo comprar ropa y fue creciendo poco a poco.  Recorre los campos los fines de semana, y de lunes a viernes recorre la ciudad por la tarde particularmente.  Es casada y su esposo se dedica al campo, trabajando en su propia finca.  Tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector donde habitan.  Desea a futuro poder comprar un vehículo y crecer mucho más con su negocio.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de arroz, sábanas y otros productos para su comercialización.
texts.en: Maria Monserrate is from the City of Quevedo.  She started out with some money that her son gave her, which allowed her to purchase clothing, and since then the business has been growing gradually.  She goes out to the fields during the weekends, and from Monday through Friday she goes around the city to sell, particularly in the afternoons.  In the future, she wants to buy a vehicle and grow her business.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy rice, bed sheets, and other products to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maricela Yolanda

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás vendiendo golosinas, como le fue bien con ésto, amplió su oferta e incluyó víveres.  Hasta ahora el negocio le ha resultado muy productivo.  Trabaja sola en su casa, todos los días.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su cónyuge se dedica a la pesca artesanal.  Tiene 4 hijos menores de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Su sueño es llegar a tener su propio mini market en el perímetro cercano a su domicilio.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, harina, colas, legumbres y otros productos para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started some time ago by selling candy, and as this went well she expanded her selection and included groceries. So far the business has been very profitable. She works on her own at home every day. 

She is in a common-law relationship and her spouse is a small-scale fisherman. She has four minor children and they go to the area's public school. Her dream is to succeed in having her own minimart on the ring road near her home. Now she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, soft drinks, vegetables and other products to sell.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Yesica Maribel

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás, vendiendo enseres y productos varios por el sector.  Como le fue bien, decidió comprar más productos para ampliar su oferta.  Esta actividad le ha resultado muy productiva desde entonces.  Trabaja sola todos los días, haciendo sus recorridos de acuerdo a los pedidos que le realizan.  Es casada y su esposo es comerciante de pescado.  Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector donde habitan.  A futuro desea tener su propia tienda naturista.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Libertad.  She started some time ago, selling household items and various products around the neighborhood. As it went well, she decided to buy more products to expand her selection. This business has been very profitable for her since then. She works on her own every day, making the rounds in accordance with the orders she receives. 

She is married and her husband is a fish vendor. She has two minor children and they go to the the public school in the area where they live. Someday she wishes to have her own natural food store. Now she needs the loan to buy natural products to sell.

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Leonardo Napoleón

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad debido a que en su barrio, sus amigos y vecinos, incluso él, necesitaban un medio para transportarse.  Fue cuando vio la oportunidad de adquiriri un vehiculo para poder trabajar en él.  Labora todos los días, solo y desde muy temprano en la mañana.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos, todos van a la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea a futuro poder mejorar sus ingresos para aumentar su casa y también tener más clientela en su trabajo.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de accesorios y otros artículos para el arreglo de su vehículo.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  He decided to devote himself to this business activity because in his neighborhood his friends and neighbors, including him, needed a means of transportation.  It was when he saw the opportunity to get a vehicle in order to be able to work in it.  He works alone every day, starting very early in the morning.

He is married, and his wife is a housewife.  He has three children, and they all go to the public school in his area.  In the future, he wishes to be able to improve his income in order to expand his house.  He also wishes to have more customers in his work.

He now needs the loan to buy accessories and other items to fix his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy accessories and other items to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Vilma Raquel

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con su negocio una vez que su cónyuge la abandonó y le dejó deudas pendientes.  Fue entonces que por consejo de sus amigos y familiares, emprendió decididamente en la venta de cosméticos.  Realiza su trabajo sola, recorriendo diferentes sectores de la ciudad de 10 am a 4 pm.  Es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad.  A futuro le gustaría poder montar su propio bazar en su domicilio.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de perfumes, bisutería y cremas de belleza.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started with her business when her husband abandoned her, and he left her with outstanding debts.  That was when, upon advice from her friends and family, she definitively decided upon selling cosmetics.  She works alone by traveling to the different areas in the city from 10:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She is a single mother, and she has a five year old child.

In the future, she would like to be able to set up her own variety store in her house.  She now needs the loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, and beauty creams.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó su negocio tiempo atrás, en el sitio donde es su domicilio, debido a que existe un Colegio justo en frente.  Además, se estableció un destacamiento policial, lo que le brindó mucha confianza.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, de 7 am a 7 pm.  Es divorciada y tiene un hijo de 13 años que estudia en el colegio fiscal de su área.  Desea a futuro poder ampliar su local para montar un cyber.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de cuadernos, fomix y plumas para su venta.
texts.en: Natalia is from the city of Libertad.  She started her business some time ago in the place where her home is, because a school is located right in front.  Also, a police station is there, which gives her a lot of confidence.  She works on her own every day from 7am until 7pm.  Natalia is divorced, and she has a 13 year-old daughter who attends the local public school.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and establish an internet cafe.  At this time, she needs a loan to invest in notebooks, craft foam, and pens for her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery goods and general merchandise

loans.name: Dionicio Moisés

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició su negocio primeramente como trabajador en venta de productos naturales y posteriormente se independizó.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8 am a 8 pm, por su propia cuenta.  No es casado y tampoco tiene hijos.  Aspira en un futuro poder tener su propio local para comercializar sus productos.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de productos naturales y vitaminas.
texts.en: Dionicio is from the city of Libertad.  He started out working as an employee selling natural health products, and later he established his own business.  He works on his own Mondays through Saturdays from 8am until 8pm.  He is not married, and he has no children.  In the future, he aspires to have his own store where he could sell his products.  Right now, he needs a loan to buy natural health products and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy natural health products

loans.name: Kena Elizabeth

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició su negocio una vez terminó sus estudios secuandarios.  Ha trabajado y estudiado muy duro simultáneamente, incluso después de obtener su título en la universidad. Escogió la venta de cosméticos debido a que le daba algo de tiempo para dedicarse a realizar sus tareas universitarias.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, de 2 a 7 pm.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, de 7 y 9 años, que estudian en la escuela fiscal del lugar donde habitan.  Le gustaría en un futuro poder tener un local de bazar en su domicilio y luego también, una boutique.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cremas, perfumes y bisutería para su venta.
texts.en: Kena is from the city of Libertad.  She started her business once she finished high school.  She has worked and studied very hard concurrently, even after obtaining her degree from the university.  She chose to sell cosmetics because it gave her some time to devote to her university studies.  She works alone every day from 2 to 7pm.  She is a single mother with 2 children aged 7 and 9 who study in the local public school.  In the future, she would like to have a general store in her home, and later also a boutique.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy creams, perfumes, and accessories for her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Josephine.  She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 12 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  

In 2005, Josephine established her firewood and charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to develop herself and her family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Josephine requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal and bundles of firewood for resale.

Josephine used the profit from her last loan to provide a livelihood for her children and pay school fees. She was unable to build stores.

In the future, Josephine plans to continue supporting her children’s education and build stores and shops for business purposes. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 13 years and 9 months. In 2003, Fatmata established her cosmetics, synthetic hair and Vocational Training Centre business. She began her business because she wants to financially help her husband in taking care of the home. Working 7 days a week and 15hrs a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more hair dressing equipment, cosmetics and synthetic hair for resale. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a bigger vocational training centre and a salon, after getting more customers. She thanks you for your support .

loans.use: to buy more hair dressing equipment, cosmetics and synthetic hair for resale.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has two children aged 11 and 7 years. In 2002, Memunatu established her sugar-by-bag and babywear business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in providing the livelihood for their family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of sugar and babywear of different kind for resale. In the future, Memunatu plans to become a wholesaler.  She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of sugar and babywear of different kinds for resale

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Alieu. He is married and has one child, age 3 years. In 2007, Alieu established his drinks, provisions, mobile phone recharge cards, and electronic voucher for mobile recharge business. 

He began his business because he want to become self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Alieu requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, milk, mayonnaise, sugar and mobile phone recharge cards for resale. 

In the future, Alieu plans to build a bigger shop and educate his children to university level. He is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, milk, mayonnaise, sugar, and mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Saidu. He is married and has 4 children aged 9, 6, and 3 years old as well as a 2 month old baby. In 2007, Saidu established his jewelry business. He began his business just to support his family. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days per week for 11 hours per day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy necklaces that cost 500,000 SLL, perming creams at 500,000 SLL each, and roll-on at 600,000 SLL each. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock levels. In the future, Saidu plans to establish a branch in Bo and to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry for his shop

loans.name: Abdulai M.

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Abdulai. He is married and has four children, ages 14, 12, 8 and 5. He has two additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  

In 2002, Abdulai established his radio, belt, mobile phones and accessories (electronics) business. He began his business just to adequately cater for his family. His business is located at city centre and his main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Abdulai has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy radios, mobile phones and belts for his business. He hopes that this loan will increase his income level. In the future, Abdulai plans to develop his plot of land and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories, radios and belts.

loans.name: Ronarld

texts.en:
Ronald lives in Kericho, a very fertile land for agriculture. He is married and has four children and has been doing farming for nine years.Ronald owns cows, poultry, and mosquito net, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops. Despite facing the challenge of low returns during dry spells, he enjoys mixed farming in general.

Ronald was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, it gives loans at low interest rates. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: Every individual loan is given only if one is in a group. 

His highest monthly expense is transporting his produce to the market. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Ronald replied, they will be able to have more plantings due to the greenhouse and this will increase their income.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer who lives in Kericho. She has one child and has been doing this work for 17 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

She said that mixed farming always brings satisfaction to her, but her biggest challenge is finding ready markets for her produce.

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that they offer low interest rates on their loans. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she replied that they offer loans to small income earners.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Mary replied they will get more income because of the sale of eggs from the poultry, and thus a better life.

Mary owns cows and poultry but does not own pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca 
Operación 2013-152
600.000

Rebeca es madre de 2 hijos, trabajadora y emprendedora, después de su separación y con el apoyo de sus padres inicia el negocio de venta de ropa, al residir cerca del colegio ofrece el servicio de bazar y librería el cual está interesada en fortalecer con este préstamo. 

Su empeño la ha llevado a tener una actividad consolidada que le ha ayudado a atender a sus hijos. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar fuera de la casa, pero para estar cerca de ellos decidió implementar este negocio. Desea obtener mejores ganancias al comprar ella misma los productos (sandalias de Nicaragua) las cuales tiene mucha aceptación en la zona. Contribuye también a los gastos de su casa. Tiene cerca de 12 años de experiencia en el comercio, desea ahorrar para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Inició con la liquidación de un trabajo, hace cerca de 3 años, ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres y su abuela. Ha re invertido y conseguido diversificar sus productos, ofreciendo ropa, zapatos, productos de bazar y para estudiantes, además vende choco bananos.

Mantiene una clientela fija de cerca de 54 personas a crédito;  además vende de contado y ofrece productos de moda. Se cuenta con un local propio, establecido en el corredor de la casa de sus padres, la tienda bazar está ubicada detrás del colegio de chacarita, por lo que vende a estudiantes productos de comida (choco Bananos) además de ofrecer productos escolares y de bisutería. Vende ropa que le confecciona una amiga (generando empleo) y desea comercializar directamente las sandalias que le traen de Nicaragua, ya que tiene un buen margen de ganancia, por lo que va a utilizar este préstamo para comprarlas directamente. Clientela  estable, que le permite invertir en mercadería de temporada.
texts.en:
Rebeca 
Operation 2013-152
600,000

Rebeca is the mother of 2 children. She is hardworking and enterprising. After her separation and with the help of her parents, she started her business selling clothes. Since she lives close to the high school she also sells variety store and bookstore items. She is interested in fortifying this with a loan.   

Her hard work has led to her having a steady activity that has helped her care for her children. Previously she worked outside of her house, but to be closer to them she decided to start her business. She wants to obtain better profits by buying the products herself (sandals from Nicaragua) which are very popular in the area. She also contributes to the household expenses. She has close to 12 years' experience as a merchant. She wants to save to give her children a better future. She started with severance pay from her job close to 3 years ago and has had her parents' and her grandmother's help.  She has re-invested and been able to diversify her products, offering clothes, shoes, miscellaneous and school products, as well as chocolate bananas.  

She has regular customers and close to 54 people she sells to on credit. She also charges people up front and offers products that are in style. She has her own locale set up in the corridor of her parents' house. The variety store is located behind the Chacarita high school and she sells food to the students (chocolate bananas) as well as school products and jewelry. She sells clothes that a friend makes (generating employment) and she wants to sell the sandals brought from Nicaragua because they have a good profit margin. She is going to use this loan to buy them directly. She has regular customers, which allows her to invest in seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, clothing, bookstore products and more.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia 
2013-184
¢600.000

María Eugenia es una señora de 39 años, casada, vive con sus tres hijos, una asiste al colegio, otra a la escuela y el menor al jardín de niños. Su esposo realiza trabajos en construcción de forma esporádica. Ante esta situación, hace 10 años, compran dos docenas de gorras y las venden en el centro de Puntarenas, al ver que les funciona lo repiten hasta llegar al día de hoy, con un puesto de venta fijo en el centro de esta misma ciudad; desde  donde comercializan ropa, sandalias, gorras, perfumes entre otros artículos según la temporada. 

Recibe ingresos por sus ventas de forma diaria, ahorra y paga a sus proveedores de contado, lo que demuestra una buena capacidad para la administración del dinero. Tiene un negocio consolidado y ventas estables.

Este negocio les permitió comprar un lote y ahora están construyendo su casa.  Su deseo es continuar brindándoles estudio a sus hijos y terminar la casa que está muy avanzada.

Este crédito lo quiere utilizar para aumentar la mercadería ofrecida a sus clientes para la temporada alta, comprando esta mercadería de contado, obteniendo así mejores precios con sus proovedores. Comercializa ropa de hombre, mujer y niño y al aproximarse el fin de año y la temporada de verano es importante, para el negocio adquirir inventario de moda.
texts.en:
María Eugenia 
2013-184
600,000 CRC

María Eugenia is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her three children. One goes to secondary school, one goes to primary school, and the youngest is in kindergarten. María Eugenia's husband has occasional work in the construction industry. Ten years ago, before they had their current business, they would buy dozens of hats and sell them in downtown Puntarenas. Once they saw that this worked, they repeated the cycle until getting to where they are today, with an established sales location in the center of this same city. They now sell clothes, sandals, hats, perfumes, and other items according to the season.

María Eugenia gets daily earnings from her sales, and she saves and pays her suppliers in cash, which demonstrates that she has a good capacity for managing money. She has an established business and stable sales.

This business has allowed María Eugenia and her husband to buy a plot of land, and they are currently building their home. María Eugenia's desire is to continue to support her children in their education, and to finish construction on her home, which is very far along.

María Eugenia would like to use this loan to increase the merchandise that she can offer to her customers during the high season. She will buy this merchandise in cash, getting better prices from her suppliers in this way. She sells men's, women's, and children's clothing. As the end of the year approaches, she would like to acquire stylish inventory for the business, since the summer season is very important.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, shorts, bathing suits, hats, skirts, and glasses.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 35 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, Venuste wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives in Kericho, an area known for having the best tea plantations. He has one child and has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, transportation services through a motorbike.

He says what is most enjoyable about farming is the returns gotten out of selling his produce, and his biggest challenge is lack of professional training regarding agriculture.

Edwin was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that it is a good company with low interest rates.

His highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Edwin replied that through poultry keeping he will earn more income through the sale of eggs and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kisii. She has 6 children. Her primary income sources are milk.  She has been doing this work for 8 years

Alice stated what is most enjoyable about farming: milking her dairy cows.  Her biggest challenge is weeding her plantation.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyota.'

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, it offers better services.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she replied, that they offer their loans at a low interest rate.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked, how will this loan benefit her family, Alice replied that it will help her purchase a water tank to help with irrigation.  

Alice owns the following: cow, poultry, mosquito net, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile,electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en:
Joseah lives in Kericho, a very green area where there is a lot of tea on the farms.  He has eight children and has been doing farming for 23 years.  His primary income sources are milk,and tea.

Joseah stated what is most enjoyable about farming: practicing mixed farming.  He says that it is quite expensive to manage the farm.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelmet.'

Joseah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: loan repayment is at a lower interest rate.  This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he said how to do farming as a business.  When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Joseah replied it will help him build a zero grazing area, allowing him to take care of his dairy cows in a better way.  He hopes his cows will be more productive and improve his income.

Joseah owns the following: cow, poultry, mosquito net, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile,electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing area

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Meet Jeremiah who lives in Kericho, a very fertile land for the production of tea. He has six children and has been doing this work for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: reaping the benefits of his hard work in the farm. His biggest challenge is: lack of enough capital. An animals on the farm has been given the name of Seroy.

Jeremiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it finances small-scale farmers.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: doing farming as a business brings in more profit.

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Jeremiah replied, 'there will be an Increase in income because the cow will be fed due to the construction of the zero-grazing unit.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jeremiah owns the following: 'cow, poultry,mosquito net, TV,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.'

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit for his cow.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick Kipsiele lives in Kericho, where there is an excellent climate for agriculture. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 3 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops. Even though he faces the challenges of controlling ticks on cattle and poultry diseases, he really enjoys poultry and dairy farming.
 
Erick Kipsiele was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that it will help him grow his agribusiness. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "MFIs give grace period." His highest monthly expenses are school fees. He said that this loan will help him construct a dairy unit, which will bring in more income, and thus help in paying school fees. 

Erick Kipsiele owns cows, a pump, and a bicycle, but does not own pigs, poultry, motorcycle, or automobile.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Meet Geoffrey, who lives in Kericho, an area known for tea production. He has one child.  

He has been doing farming for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. He loves farming, but he says it is quite expensive to manage a farm.

Geoffrey is asking a loan to buy more poultry.  He said he chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because they offer their loans at a low interest rate.  He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: that it is good to develop a lifestyle of saving. 

This loan will be of great benefit to his family because they will have more income through the sale of eggs from the poultry. Geoffrey has cows and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of the country. He has 4 children and has been farming for 7 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea. He says that farming has good returns, but the disadvantage in having a lot of produce is that the harvest may be so large that some of the farm produce ends up going bad, leading to a loss for him.

James chose to request a loan from Juhudi Kilimo because their loans are offered at low rates. This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He learned that MFIs help low income farmers to improve their livelihoods. This loan will help him to purchase poultry for egg production and thus improve his income base and his standard of living. James owns cows, but does not own pigs, poultry, pumps, bicycles, motorcycles, or automobiles. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond lives in Kericho, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. He has been farming for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and transportation services. He says that farming has high returns but the major challenge is in the pest and disease control. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, he said that they have a low interest rate on their loans. He was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and said that loans from microfinance institutions provide a greater advantage to small scale farmers. When asked how his family would benefit, he said that it will help them construct a greenhouse which they will use to plant more crops, generate more income, and hence improve their livelihoods. Raymond owns cows, poultry, and a motorcycle but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kericho. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk and crops. She loves farming a lot but she says that farming can be very expensive.

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that it  "provides funds to low income earners". Rose was also asked what was learnt during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "that MFIs give weekly training before giving out loans." When asked how this loan would benefit her family, she said that she would buy more poultry and thus more eggs would be available for sale leading to increased income.

Rose owns the following: 'cows,' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Meet Rosaline, a very active farmer in Kericho. She loves farming and has been doing it for 10 years. Her source of income comes from the sale of milk and tea. Despite the challenge of having insufficient capital, she enjoys the profit that she gets from selling her farm output. 

Rosaline says that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because it helps low income earners to rise up economically by offering loans for asset financing. Rosaline says that during Juhudi's micro-finance training session, she learnt that MFIs help low-level earners to develop a savings culture. She says that this loan will enable her construct a zero grazing unit and thus create a good environment for her dairy cows to produce more, and this will lead to more income being generated and thus improve her family's living standards.

Roseline owns cows, but does not own pigs, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Meet David, a farmer from Kericho.  David owns cows and poultry and has a tea plantation.  He derives his income from selling tea, milk, and eggs.

He loves farming and has done it for eight years. What he enjoys most about farming is poultry keeping, but he says that it is very expensive to manage a farm.

When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan to purchase poultry, he said that it is easily accessible and has low interest rates.This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: that a grace period is offered on their loans, he said.

This loan will help him purchase poultry, and he will get more eggs and therefore get more income, thus improving his living standards.  David owns the following: cows and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump,a bicycle, a motorcycle, an automobile, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Las Islas Group

texts.es: Marina quien en la fotografía aparece al costado izquierdo de sweater rojo y bufanda verde, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Islas de Castro. En este Banco Comunal los socios tienes distintos rubros tales como la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de verduras, artesanías colectivos, jardinería y venta de perfumes. Marina es artesana y teje a palillos y crochet además de hacer figuras de madera. Comenzó hace 18 años ya que ella creció en el campo y siempre estuvo queriendo aprender de esto. No ha tenido problemas pero si diferentes desafíos que se ha impuesto gracias a su trabajo en donde también confecciona con la polerones, chalecos y faldas que promociona en un desfile de modas que ella organiza con mucho esfuerzo junto a otros artesanos y que realizando en fiestas patrias chilenas (18 de Septiembre) y a principios del mes de Enero. Ella espero poder comprar Hilado, lana procesada que viene del vellón de la oveja, con el dinero que recibirá. Está muy contenta y entusiasmada ya que empezará a confeccionar sus tenidas para el verano y sabe que le irá muy bien con la venta de aquellas. Disfruta mucho el poder compartir con los demás socios del Banco Comunal al cual pertenece, eso es lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza.
texts.en: Marina, who appears in the left side of the photograph in a red sweater and green scarf, belongs to the community bank group Las Islas de Castro. In this community bank, members have different businesses such as the sale of new and used clothing, the sale of vegetables, a handicraft collective, gardening, and the sale of perfumes. Marina is an artisan who knits with thin needles and crochets in addition to making wooden sculptures. She began this work 18 years ago as she grew up in the countryside and was always was wanting to learn this craft. She has not had problems but different challenges due to her work preparing the sweaters, vests, and skirts for a fashion show that she took great effort to organize with other craftsman for performing on a Chilean national holiday (September 18th) and in early January. She hopes to buy yarn and processed wool that comes from sheep's fleece with the loan money she receives. She is very happy and excited to begin to make her summer knits and she knows she will do very well by selling these. She enjoys being able to share with the other community bank members which is what she likes most about working together with Fondo Esperanza.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Los Afortunados Group

texts.es: Mirza, quien aparece sentada de las segundas de izquierda a derecha y con una chaqueta rosada y lentes, pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Afortunados de Concepción. En este Banco Comunal los socios tienes diversos negocios tales como venta de ropa nueva, pastelería, venta de carteras, confección de lámparas, artesanía con figuras de madera, mecánica de buses. Mirza hace chocolate y teje. Este negocio lo comenzó hace 15 años cuando ella trabajó en una chocolatería en donde aprendió todo lo referente a chocolates. Le ha ido muy bien con la venta de chocolates ya que cuando más he tenido pedidos en para los días de San Valentín, día de la madre y navidad. Es por esto que ella solicita el dinero, ya que ha tenido muchos pedidos por que se acerca Navidad, comprará moldes que debe renovar y materia prima como cobertura de chocolate y trufas. Está muy contenta ya que ha tenido muchos pedidos así que espera con ansias poder recibir el dinero. Le gusta mucho trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza ya que ha conocido mucha gente que le ha ayudado y ha aprendido a conocer otras realidades que le ayudan a ganar experiencia.
texts.en:
Mirza, who is shown seated second from the left wearing a pink jacket and glasses, belongs to Los Afortunados Communal Bank in Concepcion. The members of this communal bank engage in various businesses such as new clothing sales, a bakery, handbag sales, lamp maker, artisan producing wooden figures, and bus mechanic.

Mirza makes chocolates and weaves. She started her business 15 years ago when she worked in a chocolate factory where she learned everything about chocolates. She has done very well selling chocolates and has the greatest demand at Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day and Christmas. Consequently she is applying for funds because she has received many orders as the Christmas season approaches.

She wants to buy molds, which she needs to replace, and basic ingredients such as chocolate icing and truffles. She is very pleased that she has already had so many orders and anxiously awaits receipt of the loan.

She greatly enjoys working with Fondo Esperanza because she has met many people who have helped her and she has gotten to know other ways of thinking that help her to gain experience.

loans.use: to purchase molds, chocolate icing and truffles.

loans.name: Goleta Ancud Group

texts.es: Marcela quien esta se las primeras en la fotografía con jeans y polera azul y mangas negras y pelo castaño, además tiene un lápiz en la mano; ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Goleta Ancud que está ubicado en Ancud, Castro. Los socios de Goleta Ancud tienen diversos negocios tales como artesanía, venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de queso, venta de marcos, costuras y cupach. Marcela vende ropa americana y ropa nueva, pero su fuerte es la venta de ropa americana que ella comenzó a vender hace aproximadamente más de un año, ya que se quedó sin trabajo y al conseguir un poco de dinero pudo comprar un fardo de ropa y como le fue bien en la venta decidió seguir vendiendo. Hace algún tiempo pudo junto a otra socia instalarse con un local establecido, pero tuvo problemas con la socia, lo que hizo que se retirará de negocio y decidiera seguir vendiendo como empezó, puerta a puerta; aunque con el tiempo que lleva en la venta de ropa ha podido hacerse de muchas clientas.  Con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar más fardos y ropa nueva ya que le ha ido muy bien pero no tiene dinero para comprara más y sus clientas le solicitan más ropa. Es por eso que está segura que le irá muy bien ya  que sus clientas le solicitan que les lleve más ropa. Está muy contenta con  el trabajo en Fondo Esperanza y además agradecida con las clases en las cuales las capacitan como cuidar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marcela is in the front row of the photograph wearing jeans and a blue sweater with black sleeves. She has dark hair and is holding a pen in her hand.  

Marcela belongs to the communal bank Goleta Ancud, which is located in Ancud, Castro. The members of Goleta Ancud have a variety of businesses, including handicrafts, new and used clothing sales, cheese sales, frame sales, sewing, and découpage. 

Marcela sells American clothes and new clothes, but her strength is in American clothes, which she began to sell just over a year ago. At the time, she didn't have work and when she came into a bit of money she was able to buy a bale of clothes. Since this went well, she decided to continue selling clothes. Some time ago, she set herself up at a physical store alongside a business partner. However, she had problems with this partner and so she withdrew from the business. She decided to continue to sell clothes in the way that she started - door to door. She has been able to gain many customers in her time selling clothes.

With the money that she is requesting, Marcela plans to buy more bales of new clothes, since sales have been good but she doesn't have money with which to buy more, and her customers have been asking for more clothing. For this reason, she is sure that things will go well, since her customers are asking her to bring them more clothes. Marcela is happy with Fondo Esperanza's work, and grateful for the classes they offer, in which they provide training on how to look after your business.

loans.use: to buy bales of American clothing and new clothes.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 48 years old. She is a mother of seven children. She sells flour, and has spent four years in the business. With the loan, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy more tonnes of flour for sale. She expects to get more profits from the business as she is hoping to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy flour for sale

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 33 years old. She is married to a businessman. 

Vestine owns a butcher shop that she has been running for the past three years. She has requested a loan to buy more meat to sell in her shop. 

She expects more profits from the business, and she plans to use it for renovating her house as well as for providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 35 years old. She is married with four children and they all go to schools. She owns a bar and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sodas and beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en: Sifa is 31 years old. She is married with three children. She sells meat in her butcher shop and has spent two years in the business. She would like to get a loan for buying more meats for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more meats for sale.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 52 years old. She is married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past six years. She wants the loan to buy more bananas, beans and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 46 years old. She is a mother of five children. Her husband works as a house builder. She has been selling cooking oil and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emeritha

texts.en:
Emeritha is 36 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, potatoes, and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings. She is very successful from the previous loan and she hopes to use this, as well.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, bananas, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 31 years old. She is married with two children, aged two and nine. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 37 years old. She is married with five children aged between six and sixteen years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past fifteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is aged 31. She is a mother of one child aged five. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past four years. She wants the loan to buy more shirts and trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house for residence.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Eliezar

texts.en: Eliezar is 30 years old. He sells clothes, which he has been doing for 13 years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more clothes to sell. Eliezar will use the profits from the business to increase his savings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 51 years old,  widowed, and has three children. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more beans, potatoes, and bananas to sell. Rose will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old. He is single and has been selling clothes for the past 13 years. With the loan, he wants to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old. He is married with three children, between 13 and 17 years old.  They all go to school. 

Emmanuel sells clothes and has been in business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sale. 

With the profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sale.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 22 years old. She is married with one child, aged one.  

With the loan, she would like to buy juices, snacks, eggs, and sodas for resale.  

The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: to buy more juices, snacks and eggs for resale.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 33 years old.  She sells foodstuffs and has been for five years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for resale.  

She plans to pay for her children’s school fees from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 33 years old and the mother of two children, one and five. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more soda, mineral water, and beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more soda, mineral water, and beer for sale.

loans.name: Philmin

texts.en:
Philmin is 55 years old. He sells kids clothing, which he has been doing for the past ten years. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more kids clothing to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more kids clothing to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 24 years old and the mother of one child. 

She sells clothes and socks for different people. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

She has been successful from the past loans as she grown her stock to the point of becoming a wholesaler in clothes. She still has the same zeal to expand her business from a similar loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 38 years old. She is a mother of five children. She sells electronics equipment. She has been helpful in encouraging business growth, as she invests in more stocks of new items like bicycle spare parts. She has been in the business for one year. With a loan, she would like to buy more bicycle spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste aged 41. She is married with five children between ages seven and twenty. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past three years. Evaste has requested this loan to buy more charcoal for sale. With the profits from the increased business, she will pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is 38 years old. She is married with two children. She has been selling threads and fabrics for the past seven years. 

With the loan she has requested she will buy a sewing machine to use in her business of making clothes. She plans to use the profits to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for use in the business of making clothes.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en: Africano is a fifty-three-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ten years ago he decided to venture into agriculture in order to earn money to support the family. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university and also set up sustainable income generating activities. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes are his major challenges while his dream is to venture into modern farming methods so as to increase the seasonal output. Africano intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a thirty-six-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the clothing business for three years, working seven days a week and twelve hours a day since his business is located at the border where there are very many activities. Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect his business growth while his dream is to own a modern boutique. 

Isaac intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is from Vandzor town where he lives with his wife (in the photo) and son. He has been driving a taxi for  10 years and is already a very skillful driver. Due to his hard work, Seyran earns enough income to cover his family's daily costs. 

Unfortunately his car is now in bad condition and Seyran has no saved money for renovating it. So by applying for this loan he is asking for a financial support to be able to pay for renovation of the car and to purchase new tires. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Seyran and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of their car and to purchase new tires

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. Abbas works hard to provide for his family all by himself.

Abbas is a barber. He has a long experience in this field, and has been practicing this business since 2007. Through his years of work, Abbas gained the respect of his neighborhood, and became very popular with an excellent reputation.

Abbas is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop and buy a new hair-cutting chair for his shop. Abbas is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and buy a new hair-cutting chair.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 62-year-old hard working Iraqi client. He is married and has three children.

Mahdi owns a small restaurant in his neighborhood; he specializes in making very delicious local sandwiches, and is highly respected and well-known in his neighborhood. Mahdi established his business in 2005 and has much experience in what he practices.

Mahdi is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling, a rolling shutter, and to buy a motor generator. 

Mahdi is aiming to grow his business even more, so he may improve the quality of his family's life.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling, a rolling shutter, and to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman. She has five children, three of whom attend school and two who are underage. Luvuno owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Luvuno operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married mother of five school going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Subira has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past eight years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a divorced woman and has one child who is an adult. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a business selling fish for the last 3 years. She sells fish at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she operates a motorbike that she uses for transportation.

Saumya decided to join to acquire financial services for her business. With the Kshs 40,000 from the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, firewood and spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, firewood and spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is a married woman with five children, three of whom are old enough to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mbeyu operates a cereal-selling business out of her home. Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of supplies. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy sacks of maize to resell. She joined Yehu to get financial support for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariana has operated a clothes selling business for the past ten years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  Mariana decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married, and has a single child. Taleb is a very well-known grocer in the neighborhood. He works to sell canned foods, dairy products, drinks, vegetables, and fruits. He has long experience in this field, having established his business in 2000. Taleb has an excellent reputation and is respected by all of his customers.

Taleb is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD, which he will use to buy a motor generator and to increase his sales goods inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and open a bigger supermarket so he may pass it to his only child, guaranteeing him a good business with a good income.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and to increase his sales goods inventory

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en:
Jabbar is a married Iraqi client. He is 66 years old and has a single child. Jabbar and his son provide the family income together. Jabbar owns a small shop where he sells cigarettes, cigars and lighters. He has been practicing this business since 2010 and has been growing and expanding his business ever since. Jabbar is well-known in the market and is respected by many. He has gained an excellent reputation.

Jabbar is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to expand his shop and to buy more goods to sell. Jabbar is aiming to grow his business even more so he may provide a better income for his family and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his shop and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a farmer from Vahagni village in the Lori region; she lives with her husband and son. With the help of her family members, she has a business breeding cows, pigs, and hens, she grows grass, and is in beekeeping. Margarita's husband helps her manage the agricultural products and the honey in the local market. 

As the autumn is progressing, she needs to buy some forage for the livestock. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for the livestock (grass and barley). 

She took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to recent hard work, Margarita was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history, and have no access to credit products. 

Margarita and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock (grass and barley)

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is an experienced farmer from Urut village of Lori region. She lives with her husband. With the help of her husband, Karine is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, sheep, pigs, and hens, and in the cultivation of grass. They realize the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the family's only source of income. 

As life is getting more expensive with time, Karine needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to make ends meet. A loan of USD 3,000 will help her greatly by enabling her to purchase wheat seeds, pay for the harvesting services, buy a cow, purchase some forage for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

Karine and her husband will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, wheat seeds, and forage for the livestock, pay for harvesting services, and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is married and lives with his wife in Vanadzor town. Upon returning from the army, Harutyun, two years ago, started to earn his living by providing renovation service to locals. Over the two years of hard work Harutyun gained good experience, and now his service is much demanded in the town. 

By applying for this loan, Harutyun asks financial support for being able to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work. 

Harutyun has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Harutyun to have the tools he needs and be able to provide better service for his clients.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing renovation services

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is married and lives in Vanadzor town with his wife. 

Samvel has a delivery business; he purchases different products (food, housing products, etc.) and sells them to small local stores. Due to his hard work and good attitude towards people, Samvel has a large number of customers who order products only from him. 

Now Samvel needs financial support to purchase a new stock of products, and to cover new orders. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Samvel to be able to continue and expand his business. The good income is very important for this young family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of products to sell to stores

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Gyumri town. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. Artur has been involved in the auto repair business for many years. Near the house where Artur and his family live, Artur owns a small garage where he provides different services for automobiles. Due to his hard work, Artur is able to earn enough income and cover his family's basic costs. Now to enlarge his business, Artur needs financial support. He asks for this loan to purchase spare parts for automobile to be able to cover new orders from his clients.
 
Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is highly important for this hard working man to continue his business and be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for his auto repair service

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Vanadzor town. He lives with his wife, their 3-year-old daughter, and parents. 

Davit earns income for his family by driving a taxi. Last year he borrowed money and purchased a car. During a year of hard work, Davit was able to cover most of the debt. But at the same time he has to take care of family's expenses, so he wasn't able to fully cover it. 

Now, by applying for this loan Davit asks a loan to be able to make the debt repayment. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  

The loan is very important for Davit to be able to fully cover his debts and continue his taxi driving. Davit hopes for lenders' good will and support.

loans.use: to pay the debt he owes for his taxi

loans.name: Varya

texts.en:
Varya is married with two little daughters. She lives in Vanadzor town and is engaged in the sale of cosmetics. She purchases her stock of cosmetics from Yerevan and resells it in Vanadzor town. Varya has been involved in this activity for over four years and has a large number of customers and orders. Because of her family's increasing expenses, Varya now isn't able to purchase a new stock of cosmetics to sell it to her customers. That's the reason she has applied for this loan. 

Varya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Varya as she is involved in this business with great love and care and she hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri is from Vahagni village, Lori region, where he lives with his father, wife and two children (ages 8 and 6). Valeri has already been involved in the stone manufacturing business for five years. Over years of hard work, Valeri was able to sign a number of contracts with companies who purchase the stones that Valeri produces and manufactures. 

Currently because of high costs, Valeri isn't able to purchase tools and materials needed for production. He is asking for this loan and hopes for lenders' support. Valeri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Valeri to be able to continue his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for his stone manufacturing business

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en: Arkadi is from Vanadzor town. He has been involved in the production of cutlets for almost two years. Arkadi produces cutlets and sells them to local restaurants. Due to his high quality work, Arkadi was able to form agreements with many local restaurants who order cutlets only from him. Now Arkadi needs financial support to purchase a meat grinder needed for the production. The current meat grinder that Arkadi owns is in nonworking condition, so he has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arkadi and he hopes for lenders' support. Arkadi lives with his brother and his parents live in the neighboring country. Arkadi is seeking a job for sustaining their son's living.

loans.use: to pay for a meat grinder and materials for making cutlets.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is from Yerevan town and she lives with her two daughters (ages 20 and 18). Liana has already been involved in the retail business for many years. She resells clothing and dressmaking supplies to earn her family's living. Due to her hard and tireless work, Liana was able to raise her children alone and provide their living with everything they need. Now, this hardworking mother needs financial support to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to her clients. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Liana and she is waiting and hoping for the lenders' good will.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is involved in sewing activities. She has eight years of experience in this field and due to her hard work is receiving a lot of orders. She specializes in sewing bedding sets for babies and does it with great love and care. 

Now Hasmik is applying for this loan because she needs financial support for purchasing materials that she needs for sewing. Hasmik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hasmik will be grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing bedding sets for babies

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is from Vanadzor where she lives with her husband (in the photo) and 14-year-old daughter (in the photo).  Shoghik has been involved in the  cosmetics retail business for many years.  She purchases stock from the city market and then resells it to her clients.  The income from this activity isn't the only one for the family, but it is very important one.  Shoghik gathers enough income from reselling perfume to help her husband with everyday household costs.  

Now this hard working woman asks for a loan to be able to purchase new stock of perfume and resell it to her clients.  She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between KIVA and SEF International.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  The loan is very important for Shoghik to continue the business that she is involved in and gather more income for her beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of perfume for selling to customers

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en:
Koryun has been involved in mushroom production for 15 years. He produces mainly champignons and sells them at local markets. Koryun lives with his wife and three grown-up children, who help their father with production. 

Now, to be able to produce more mushrooms and increase sales, Koryun needs financial support. He asks for this loan to purchase mushroom seeds and fertilizer. Koryun has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Koryun will be very grateful to all the lenders, and the loan will greatly assist with the production of mushrooms.

loans.use: to pay for mushroom seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is from Gyumri, where he is providing taxi service. The income from this activity is very important for Suren to cover his family's costs.  Suren lives with his wife and 27-year-old son. 

Currently this hard-working man needs financial support to renovate his car. Because of its nonworking conditions, Suren isn't able to provide taxi service and gather money. So he has applied for this loan for the help. 

Suren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly, greatly assist Suren to continue his taxi business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his taxi

loans.name: Movses

texts.en: Movses is from Getap village of Vayots Dzor region. He has been providing auto repair services for the past 15 years. Due to his high quality and hard work Movses is well known among the local people of Getap village. Unfortunately the tools that Movses has are very old and need to be changed with new ones. Movses has applied for this loan to purchase new tools and equipment. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Movses with his auto repair service and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing auto repair services

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is from Lernantsq village. She has been involved in a retail clothing business for three years already. She purchases new clothing stock from Yerevan and resells it in her village. 

Arevik lives with her husband and two children and does her best to cover the family's basic costs. By applying for this loan, Arevik asks for a loan to purchase new stock of clothing to sell locally. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arevik, and she hopes for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a young jeweler from Berkanush village of Ararat region. He has been involved in the jewelry business for more than a year, and over this time of hard work, he was able to gather good income for his family. Simon lives with his mother and sister, and as the only man of the family, Simon feels very responsible in taking care of the family's costs. 

Now, Simon asks for this loan for being able to purchase tools needed for making the jewelry. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is greatly important for Simon as the work that he is doing will be more effective, and he will be able to make more jewelry.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for jewelry making.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat lives with his mother, brother, wife and two little children. A year ago Bagrat started up his furniture-making business. After this time of hard work, now he receives many orders and is able to sustain his family’s living. 

Bagrat is the main breadwinner of the family so it is very difficult for him to cover his family’s needs and at the same time save money for his input costs of production. So he has applied for this loan for purchasing materials needed for the production of furniture. Bagrat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Bagrat and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for furniture manufacturing

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is from Masis town. He lives with his parents and is involved in taxi driving. He is the only breadwinner of the family, and the income from taxi driving is vital for his family. Unfortunately because of his car's nonworking condition, Artak isn't able to drive it as a taxi. He applied for this loan to be able to renovate it. 

Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  The loan is very important for Artak and he will be very grateful to all his lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the car used as a taxi

loans.name: Nektar

texts.en:
Nektar is from Gyumri town where she lives with husband and two children. Nektar is a teacher with 6 years of experience teaching at a local school. Nektar also provides individual classes for the children at her house. Now, to be able to purchase chairs, a table and books, Nektar is asking for this loan. The loan is very important for her to be able to provide better conditions for her students. 

Nektar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
