The loan will greatly assist this hard-working teacher and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, a table and books

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is from Vanadzor town. Her husband currently is in Russia and works to support his family's living. 

In order to tackle financial hardships, Haykanush got involved in a retail business two years ago. Near the house where she and her daughter live, Haykanush sells vegetables. The income from this activity helps Haykanush to cover basic costs and it is very important for her. 

Haykanush asks a loan to purchase vegetables and resell them to locals. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great help for Haykanush and she will be very grateful for the good will of lenders.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for reselling.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak lives with his mother in Vanadzor town. He earns their living by providing retail service to local stores and individuals. Arshak owns a truck through which he purchases different goods (housing, food, etc.) from Yerevan town and resells it to local small stores of Vanadzor town. Arshak is a very enthusiastic and hard working young man who does his best  to ensure a better life for his mother. 

Now to be able to purchase new stock of supplies and cover his current orders, Arshak needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Arshak and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies for covering his current orders.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli lives with her husband in Kapan town. She is a skilled doctor with many years of experience working at a local clinic. Due to her hard work and kind attitude toward people, Nelli also provides nursing services for people in nearby villages. 

Now, as the demand for her service is increasing, she needs to have sufficient tools for being able to provide full services from her house. Nelli asks for this loan in order to purchase medical tools. 

She has has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Nelli in continuing to provide nursing services and to help people whenever they need it.

loans.use: to pay for medical tools to provide nursing services.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is from Armavir region. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. He has been driving a taxi for already four years. As the only breadwinner of the family, Vardan feels very responsible for gathering more income and ensuring a better life for his family. Now, Vardan asks for this loan to pay for renovation of his car and for gas installation. Vardan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vardan and he hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car and gas installation

loans.name: Gulkayir

texts.ru: Гулкайыр 39 лет,вдова, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Гулкайыр среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Гулкайыр в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2006 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания и сладостями, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Торгует с контейнера, реализует продукты питания и сладости. Благодаря упорному труду Гулкайыр смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Гулкайыр расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулкайыр обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых продуктов питания и сладостей для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Гулкайыр увеличить товарооборот, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en: Gulkayir is a 39 years old widow raising three children by herself.  Gulkayir has a secondary education and has very good reviews from her neighbors. They refer to her as a kind and hard-working woman. Gulkayir is the main source of income for the family.  Since 2006, she has worked as a vendor selling food and sweets, having started this business with 20,000 KGS. She sells food items and sweets out of a container. Thanks to her hard work, Gulkayir has been able to develop and expand her product.  Her business brings her about 20,000 KGS per month, which helps pay for the cost of food and other household needs for the family. The income she has received from the business has allowed Gulkayir to expand her trade. In order to further develop her business, Gulkayir has appealed to the "Bai Tushum and Partners" Microfinance Bank for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS for the purchase of wholesale food and sweets for resale.  Gulkayir will use the income from the loan to help increase turnover and the increased profit will help her raise and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy food for retail sale

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is an experienced agronomist from Metsamor village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. To take care of his family, Hasan is engaged in the cultivation of beans and greens. His son helps him realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. In the present difficult living conditions, Hasan is hardly able to cover the needs of his family, and is eager to expand his agribusiness in order to take care of the family more effectively. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase cellophane, bottles, and cable for building a greenhouse, and to buy fertilizers. The loan will support him in sustaining his agribusiness. Hasan and his family are grateful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane, bottles, and cable for building a greenhouse, and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a young farmer from the Aknashen village of Armavir region. He lives with his mother. 

To be able to take of his family's needs, Daniel is engaged in the cultivation of cabbage, peppers, greens, and alfalfa. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. Daniel's mother helps him in his everyday activities related to farming. The agribusiness is the only source of income for the family. 

To continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Daniel needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse and to buy tomato seeds for cultivation of tomatoes. The loan will help him maintain and develop his agribusiness. 

Daniel and his mother highly rely on the good will of the lenders, and they will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse and to buy tomato seeds

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced farmer from the village Vostan in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and son. To be able to cover their needs, Susanna and her family members are engaged in cattle breeding, in raising livestock of pigs, piglets, and hens, and in cultivation of corn and tomatoes. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the main source of the family's income. 

As the autumn is progressing, Susanna needs to make some investments in the agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3000 will assist her greatly, enabling her to purchase some forage for the livestock, to buy fertilizers, to pay for harvesting services, and to buy some fuel. 

Susanna and her family rely on the goodwill and support of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping them maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for the livestock, to buy fertilizers, to pay for harvesting services, and to buy some fuel.

loans.name: Buzainap

texts.ru: Бузайнап 44 года, не замужем, одна воспитывает двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 1997 году, начала бизнес в торговле женской одежды, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Бузайнап имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 14,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Бузайнап смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Бузайнап обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Зирегул планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Buzainap is 44 years old, not married, and on her own is raising two children (one daughter, one son). In 1997, she started a business trading women's clothing, using as seed money an amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Having managed to grow her business and find loyal customers, Buzainap has an average monthly income of 14,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work in the business, Buzainap was able to increase inventory and develop her business. With the aim of further increasing and expanding her business, Buzainap turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to improve inventory. Buzainap plans to invest income from the loan in inventory and to save money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: A loan of $1,850 helps Buzainap to buy women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 40 лет, не замужем, одна воспитывает троих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 1997 году, начала бизнес в торговле женской одеждой, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 32,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Рыскул имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 14,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Рыскул смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Рыскул планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Ryskul is 40 years old, not married, and on her own three is raising three children. In 1997, she started a business trading women's clothing, using as seed capital a sum of 32,000 som (KGS). Having managed to develop her business and to find loyal customers, Ryskul has an average monthly income of 14,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work in the business, Ryskul was able to increase inventory and develop her business. With the aim of further increasing and expanding her business, Ryskul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase inventory. Ryskul plans to invest income from the loan in inventory and to save money for building a new home.

loans.use: A loan of $2,075 helps Ryskul to buy women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Keiia

texts.en:
At their early intervention center for autistic children and children with developmental delays, Keiia and her husband Vargas help children by focusing on applied behavior analysis. Throughout treatments, Keiia and Vargas use computers accompanied by sensory tools to help children learn and transition into society.

For the past four years at Helping Hands Learning Academy in Southaven, Miss., the couple has used tools to help children adjust to social norms by educating them through their senses to help them be ready for daily life in school and society.

In order to enhance their philanthropic service, Keiia and Vargas searched for a business loan. Shortly after, they learned of Accion Texas Inc. and were approved for a loan to finance computers and sensory tools for their business. The loan will help the couple assist their students through their best services in the care industry, and continue to be competitive with other service providers. 

The couple agrees they are trying to keep growing and offering the best services they can via their four-member team, and they are thankful to Accion for the loan. Without it, they would be restricted to the education they could provide.

Check out their Facebook profile here: https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Helping-Hands-Learning-Academy/122025251174384/

loans.use: to finance computers and sensory tools for their business.

loans.name: Chynarа

texts.ru: Чынаре 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Чынары - средне-специальное образование, работает старшей медсестрой в районной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Чынара занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади и 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Chynara is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Chynara has a specialized high school education. She works as a senior nurse in a regional hospital. As a source of additional income for her family, Chynara is engaged in raising livestock, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Chynara today has on her homestead: two horses and one dairy cow. Monthly income comes to 16,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Chynara turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for increasing the headcount of livestock. Chynara plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save  money for further education of her children.

loans.use: A loan of $2,075 helps Chynara to buy sheep.

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулбары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулбара занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулбары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для своего сына.
texts.en: Gulbara is 48, married, and raising 4 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, having started 26 years ago with 1,000 somoni worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has a dairy cow, 2 calves, and 15 sheep, and her monthly income has grown to around 10,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Gulbara is seeking a loan of 135,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy cows.  She plans on using the extra money that this loan will allow her to earn to continue buying more livestock for her farm, as well as to set aside money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: buy cattle for her farm

loans.name: Azimbu

texts.ru: Азимбу 66 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала двоих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Азимбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Азимбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 46 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Азимбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азимбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Азимбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Azimbu is a 66-year-old widow who has been raising 2 children by herself since her husband's death, and has been running her own farm to boot.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, having started 46 years ago with 1,000 somoni worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has a dairy cow and 15 sheep on her farm, while her monthly income has grown to nearly 8,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Azimbu is seeking a loan of 50,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy sheep.  She plans on using the extra income that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to save money for a new car.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Azizkan

texts.ru: Азизкан 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Азизкан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Азизкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Азизкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 2 лошади, 13 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азизкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Азизкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку авто.
texts.en: Azizkan is 53 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Azizkan has a higher education. To provide the primary income for her family, Azizkan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 28 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Azizkan's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, 2 horses and 13 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Azizkan requested a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls in order to increase livestock headcount. Azizkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Kamiyla

texts.ru: Камийле 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Камийлы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Камийла занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Камийлы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка, а также имеет 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль, перец и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13 500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камийла обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Камийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kamiyla is 45, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and raises cattle provide the family's main income. She began eleven years ago when she bought cattle for 6,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Kamiyla now has two milk cows, one horse, two calves, and one hectare of land for planting beans, peppers, and clover. She earns 13,500 som per month. In order to further develop her farm, Kamiyla asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som so that she can buy more cows. With the earnings from the loan, Kamiyla plans to continue to increase her herds and to save enough money to repair her house

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Aishakan

texts.ru: Айшакан 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Айшакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айшакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айшакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также 0,49 ГА земельной доли на которой она ежегодно выращивает клевер и капусту. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айшакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айшакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приданное для дочерей.
texts.en:
Aishakan is 40 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Aishakan's hard work, her farming business now comprises two dairy cows as well as 0,49 hectare of land on which she annually grows clover and cabbage.  She makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Aishakan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.

Aishakan plans to re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock.  She is also planning to save enough money for her daughters' dowry.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Анаркул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en: Anarkul is 46, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and raises livestock as the main source of income for her family. She started out 16 years ago when she bought cattle for 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Anarkul now has 2 milk cows, 1 horse, and 10 sheep, and earns 5,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to build up her farm, Anarkul asked the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy more cattle. With the income from this loan, Anarkul plans to invest in more cattle and save enough money to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kanimet

texts.ru: Канимет 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Канимет - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Канимет занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канимет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канимет обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канимет планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Kanimet is 26 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband.  She has a higher education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business eight years ago with the purchase of livestock for 6,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Kanimet's hard work, her farming business now comprises one dairy cow and ten sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 3,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Kanimet has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some sheep to increase her livestock headcount.

Kanimet plans to re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Ysidora Isabel

texts.es: Ysidora es una señora de 45 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada a la venta de ropa usada . Ella tiene un gran sueño, que su negocio crezca, lo cual requiere de mercadería para sus clientes fijos y  clientes eventuales. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería nueva tales como: pantalones, faldas, camisa, perfumes, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de estilos a sus clientes y suplir con la demanda por parte de estos. Estima que el crédito le será beneficioso ya que podrá cumplir con las necesidades de sus consumidores, crecerá su negocio y sobre todo tendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Ysidora is a 45 year old woman from the city of León. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She is a merchant by trade and sells used clothing. She has a big dream: for her business to grow, which requires merchandise for her regular and occasional customers. She is asking for the loan to buy new merchandise such as pants, shirts, shirts, perfumes and more, in order to offer a variety of styles to her customers and to meet their demand. She believes that the loan will be beneficial because she will be able to meet her consumers' demands, grow her business, and above all, have better income.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, perfumes and more.

loans.name: Leonarda Cristina

texts.es: Doña Leonarda tiene 44 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de León, madre soltera de un hijo ya independiente. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella tiene un lugar fijo donde sus clientes la visitan para comprarles sus productos, por su perseverancia ha logrado mantener estable su negocio.  Su hijo la apoya económicamente para que salga adelante con su negocio; su mayor sueño es tener bastante mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: galletas, pan, golosinas, entre otros productos, con el fin de surtir su negocio e incrementar su clientela. Estima que el crédito sera de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas e ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Leonarda is 44 years old. She is originally from the city of León and is a single mother of a son who is now independent. She works as a saleswoman, selling different types of merchandise. She has a fixed establishment where her customers come to buy her products. She has kept this business running thanks to her perseverance. Her son supports her financially, so that she can get ahead with her business. Her biggest dream is to have many products to offer to her customers.

Leonarda is requesting a loan to buy products such as cookies, bread and candies, in order to stock her business and attract more customers. She believes this loan will be of great help since it will result in more sales and a higher income, and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as cookies, bread and candies.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Don Abelardo tiene 53 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos. De oficio comerciante, dedicado a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. Esta agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito ya que  su negocio es próspero y ha podido suplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar: Maíz al por mayor, cal, bolsas entre otros, con el fin de brindarle una mejor calidad de tortillas a su clientela. Estima  que el crédito le será beneficioso  ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtendrá un nivel alto de ingresos. Cumpliendo así, su sueño de apoyar a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejorar calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Abelardo, 53, is father of four children and a merchant by profession working making and selling tortillas.  He’s succeeded in getting  ahead with much effort.  He’s very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because his business prospered and he’s been able to meet customer demand.

He’s asking for a loan once again to buy corn at wholesale, lime powder and bags, among others, aiming at providing better quality tortillas for his clientele.  He feels that the loan will be beneficial for it will increase sales and he’ll earn a higher income level thus reaching his dream of supporting his children and offering them better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to buy lime powder and bags among others.

loans.name: Jehun

texts.en: Jehun is a 20-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, an infant son, and mother. Jehun has a greenhouse where he grows vegetables to sell. In addition, they have hens and sell eggs. Jehun decided to purchase calves and raise them to start a dairy business. The start-up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of USD 3,000 for purchasing calves. As the calves are raised, the family will start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of their family and with the increased income, Jehun will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, a sus 49 años de edad, es padre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la construcción, pero, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos para su familia, desea iniciar su propio negocio, para ello quiere aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presentó de adquirir un espacio donde se encontraba ubicada una tienda muy reconocida del sector y quiere iniciar allí su propia tienda de abarrotes; por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito, para comprar activos fijos (estanterías y enfriador) y surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, productos de aseo, galletería, granos, pastas, aceite, azúcar, arroz, panela, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, con el que espera generar los ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Fredy manifiesta que aún sin tener conocimiento en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, está muy motivado porque ve en él una gran fuente de ingresos y por ello quiere luchar para sacar su proyecto adelante, logrando una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en: At 49 years old, Fredy is the father of one child and is in a civil union with his partner. Throughout his adult life he has worked in construction. However, with the desire to make a better income for his family, he wants to start his own business. To do this, he wants to take advantage of an opportunity that has been presented to acquire a space located near a well-known store in the neighborhood. That's where he wants to start his own grocery business. In order to do this he is requesting the support of this loan to purchase fixed assets such as shelving and a cooler. He also wants to buy wholesale stock like dairy and meat products, cleaning products, cookies, grains, pasta, oil, sugar, rice, and brown sugar, among other basic products. This will allow him to start this project that he hopes will make the income necessary to cover his family's necessities. Fredy believes that although he does not have experience running this type of business, he is really motivated because he sees a great source of income in this. He wants to work hard to get this project going, become profitable, and achieve financial stability in order to provide his family with a better life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (shelving and a cooler) and wholesale stock (dairy products, meat products, cleaning products, cookies, grains, pastas, oil, sugar, rice, and brown sugar among other basic products).

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio, a sus 32 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 2 años. Nació en una familia humilde que por décadas se dedicó a la piscicultura, razón por la cual hoy en día él se motiva para tomar un negocio de cría de alevinos que su hermano le cedió, ya que este se casó y consiguió empleo fuera de la ciudad. Desea tomar las riendas de este negocio y sacarlo adelante, pero para lograrlo requiere mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, además de una buena inversión, razón por la cual solicita el crédito; con el dinero desea adecuar los pozos con sistemas de drenaje y comprar materia prima e insumos (crías de peces y concentrado), esto le permitirá dar inicio a su labor con la que espera generar buenos ingresos para salir adelante y tener una estabilidad económica favorable. Julio sueña con fortalecer bien su negocio y hacer de este una buena fuente de ingresos, que sea rentable y que le permita en un futuro, generar oportunidades de empleo, además sueña con convertirse en un gran empresario exitoso y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio, who is 32 years old, is married and has a 2-year-old son. He comes from a humble family who has worked in fish farming for generations, which is why he took over his brother's fish-raising business when his brother got married and found a job outside of the city.

He hope to take the reins of this business and move it forward, but this will require a lot of effort, dedication, and a good investment, which is why he is requesting this loan. With the loan, he would like to install drainage systems in the wells and purchase raw materials and supplies (fish fry and food). This will allow him to begin work, which he hopes will generate good income so that he can move forward and have economic stability.

Julio dreams of strengthening his business and making it a good source of income. He hopes that it will be profitable and will allow him to create job opportunities in the future. He also hopes to become a highly successful businessman and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to install drainage systems in the wells and purchase raw materials and supplies (fish fry and food).

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a trabajar como agricultor y, hace algunos años inició una tienda de abarrotes y estadero ubicada en una vía muy transitada de un corregimiento al oriente de la ciudad, alternando ambas actividades ha generado los ingresos suficientes para su sustento permanente. El cliente es un hombre carismático, dedicado a sus labores y perseverante, a pesar de los diferentes obstáculos que se le han presentado siempre busca la manera de sobrepasarlos y seguir adelante. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, galletería, granos, lácteos, confitería, entre otros) y para cambiar algunos activos fijos que están en mal estado, esto le ayudará a seguir avanzando y a dar una nueva perspectiva a la imagen del establecimiento, abriendo la oportunidad de incrementar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe por su labor. De esta manera Evelio seguirá luchando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de ser propietario de una salsamentaría en un barrio popular de la ciudad, que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable y un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Evelio has spent a great part of his life working in agriculture and a few years ago opened a grocery store and hostel on a very busy road in one of the districts in the east part of the city.  By alternating both activities he’s been able to generate income sufficient for his permanent support.

He’s a charismatic, persevering man who is dedicated to his work and despite obstacles that have arisen always seeks ways to overcome them and continue moving forward.  He’s motivated to request this loan to buy stock merchandise at wholesale (packaged snacks, soft-drinks, cookies and crackers, grains, dairy products, sweets, etc.) and to replace some of his fixed assets that are in poor condition.

This will ensure his continued operation and provide the establishment with a renewed appearance leading to increased sales and income earned from his work.  In this way, Evelio will continue striving to reach his dream of owning a delicatessen in one of the city’s popular neighborhoods that will make it possible for him to enjoy favorable economic stability and better well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale and to replace some of the fixed assets that need to be.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es: Remigio, a sus 43 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos de 1 y 5 años, vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Desde hace aproximadamente 27 años tiene su propio negocio, una cafetería donde ofrece alimentos fritos, gaseosas, café, minutos a celular, confitería, entre otros productos y, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar y para velar por el bienestar de sus hijos. Actualmente está pasando por una difícil situación económica, debido a los gastos médicos que ha tenido que cubrir por una enfermedad que le afecta, sin embargo, con su tenacidad, empuje y dedicación está luchando para sobrepasar esta situación y ve en el crédito un apoyo para seguir adelante; con el dinero desea comprar surtido al por mayor (galletería, mecato, gaseosas, productos cárnicos, lácteos, café, entre otros) y arreglar el refrigerador que se encuentra en mal estado; esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos disponible para la venta, con lo que podrá satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y favorecer el incremento de los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Esto le da fuerzas a Remigio para seguir luchando por su negocio y hacer de éste un establecimiento más rentable, que le genere una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Remigio, 43, is father of two children aged 1 and 5 and is in a common law relationship with his wife.  He’s had his own business for about 27 years, a cafeteria where he sells fried food, soft-drinks, coffee, mobile phone minutes, sweets, etc.  He’s generated income this way to provide sustenance at home  and to watch over his children’s well-being.

He’s currently going through a difficult patch because of some medical expenses he’s had to cover an illness that’s affecting him.  However, his tenacity, drive and dedication is pushing him to overcome this situation and he sees in the loan a help to continue moving forward.

He wants to use the money to buy stock at wholesale (cookies and crackers, packaged snacks, soft-drinks, meat products, dairy products, coffee, etc.) and to repair the refrigerator that’s in poor condition.  This will allow him to have a wider variety of goods on-hand to sell in order to meet customer demand leading to increased income earned from work.

This gives Remigio the strength to continue striving for his business and to make it more profitable so that it will generate favorable economic stability to provide his family with better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to repair the refrigerator.

loans.name: Alfonso José

texts.es: Alfonso es un campesino de 39 años de edad, viene de una familia muy humilde que se dedicaba a trabajar el campo para ganarse la vida, gracias a los conocimientos que le transmitieron sus familiares hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana para cuidar y alimentar los animales, los cuales comercializa por libras o en pie según el requerimiento de sus clientes, que principalmente son propietarios de fincas de la región; de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. El titular se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y trabajador, impulsado por las ganas de seguir progresando solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar más lechones para cría y engorde, pues desea aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en su casa, en el que adecuó una nueva porqueriza; esto le ayudará a aumentar su producción, especialmente para satisfacer la demanda creciente que tiene por la época navideña que se aproxima, en la que sus ventas tienden a incrementar, beneficiando las finanzas familiares. Es así como Alfonso quiere seguir luchando día a día, con empeño y dedicación, pues su ideal es seguir asumiendo la responsabilidad económica de su casa, velar por el bienestar de su esposa y disfrutar junto a ella una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 39, works in agriculture and comes from a humble family who worked in the fields to earn a living.  Thanks to the skills his family taught him, today he works raising pigs.  He works from the earliest hours of the morning to care for and feed his animals that he then sells by the kilo or on the hoof according to his customers’ specifications.  His main customers are farm owners in the region.  He earns his living this way and provides sustenance for his home.

He’s noted for being driven, active and hardworking.  Urged on by the wish to continue making progress, he’s asking for a loan’s help to buy more piglets to raise and fatten up because he wants to take advantage of space he has available at home where he set up a new pig sty.  This will help him increase production especially to meet customer demand that increases in the upcoming Christmas season when sales tend to rise benefitting his family finances.

Alfonso wants to continue striving day to day with effort and dedication, then, to continue assuming the economic responsibility of his home and to watch over his wife’s well-being to enjoy better quality of life by her side.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fatten up.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 40 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de León, Casada y madre de 8 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, el cual  tiene años de experiencia. Su expectativa es que su negocio se convierta en una miscelánea donde pueda ofrecer una cantidad de productos variados.
 María está solicitando el crédito para comprar: café, arroz, jabón, aceite, pan, pampers, entre otros, con el fin de aumentar sus productos y  mejorar la variedad de mercancías para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias, logrando así tener mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
María, 40, is from the city of León.  She’s married and mother of 8 children.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She’s a grocer and has years of experience.  Her expectation is that her business will become a variety store where she can offer a wide variety of products.

María’s asking for the loan to buy coffee, rice, soap, oil, bread, Pampers, etc. aiming at increasing he products and improving the variety of merchandise she has on offer for her customers.  She believes the loan will help her increase sales and earn higher profits thus attaining better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ana Paola

texts.es: Ana es una madre soltera de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que adquirió hace aproximadamente 8 meses, como resultado de un cambio que hizo con el propietario quien le dio la facilidad de pagar en cuotas mensuales el valor total del establecimiento, allí trabaja de Lunes a Sábado, aplicando los conocimientos que adquirió en diferentes cursos de capacitación que realizó; cuenta con la ventaja de estar muy bien ubicado, en una calle muy transitada lo que le permite atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes; de esta manera genera los recursos económicos que requiere para solventar las necesidades y gastos básicos de su hogar. La titular es una mujer muy activa, alegre y carismática, apasionada por su labor; siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan avanzar para cumplir sus objetivos por esta razón encuentra en el crédito, un apoyo para fortalecer su capital de trabajo, pues con el dinero comprará herramientas de trabajo e insumos al por mayor (tijeras, secador, plancha para el cabello, tratamientos capilares, tinturas, entre otros), esto le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, especialmente en la temporada de navidad, en la que las solicitudes del servicio incrementan pues generalmente las personas desean verse bien presentadas en estas fechas especiales, esto le aumenta notablemente los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Ana manifiesta que su principal objetivo es seguir mejorando su técnica y sus conocimientos para llevar su negocio a convertirse en una sala de belleza de alto nivel, que sea más competente en el mercado y, que le garantice mejores ingresos para dar a sus hijos una excelente educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother of two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  She has her own business where she works in a beauty salon.  She acquired this approximately 8 months ago, as a result of a change in ownership.  The owner gave her the option to pay for the total value of the property in monthly installments.  
 
She works here Monday through Saturday, applying her knowledge she acquired from different training courses.  She has the advantage of being in a good location where there is a busy street and she can attract new customers.  In this way, she can generate economic resources to meet the basic needs for her home.  

Ana is a very active, happy, and charismatic woman who is passionate about her work.  She is always looking for new alternatives that will allow her to advance in meeting her objectives.  It is because of this that she discovered the loan options which support an increase in working capital.  

She will use this money to buy working tools and input (scissors, a hair dryer, an iron for hair, hair treatments, dyes, and others).  This will permit her to provide a better service to her clients, especially in the Christmas season.  At this time of year, the requests for services increase because generally people want to look good on these special occasions.  

This will increase her income dramatically.  Ana has stated that her principal objective is to continue to better her technical skills and knowledge to transform her business to a higher level.  She also wants to be more competent in her market to guarantee a better income.  With this, she can provide an excellent education and quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy working tools and input (scissors, a hair dryer, an iron for hair, hair treatments, dyes, and others)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the Paynesville area,   She is married and her husband is a social worker.  They have eight children between 12 and 25 years old.  Only three are in school and live at home. For the past eight years, she has been involved with sales of door locks, hinges, nails, etc. She makes a profit and has many customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business.  She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 36 years old and married with an 18-year-old son. His retired mother lives with the family as well. In fact, the family lives without a source of income, as the family members are jobless and the small agricultural activities they have are insignificant.

In order to generate income, Shalva decided to purchase a truck and work on firewood transportation. With this loan, Shalva will pay for the truck and start the business. He will carry firewood from the forest, cut it, and sell it to locals. The majority of Georgian villages use wood fuel for heating in the wintertime and now is high season as people purchase supplies. Shalva will transport building materials in the other seasons and serve the local furniture factory. Shalva hopes he will earn good income and improve their standard of living. The family hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to transport firewood from the forest for selling

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 27 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is unmarried, and her fiancee is a local businessman. They have two children, age 3 and 8; they are both in school.

Ophelia who runs a business from a table in her community, where she has a lot of customers. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She plans to make more money and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Nargizi

texts.en:
Nargizi, age 62, is from the capital city. She is married to Yuri, who is a stone worker and works on special projects. Nargizi's economic activity is her newly started grocery store near her house, where she sells different kinds of food. Her project is going well, but it needs financial support for further developing. 

Now, Nargizi is requesting a loan to add stock of merchandise to her store. With the received amount, she will buy products such as rice, dairy products, snacks and other products. She will enlarge her store and attract more customers. Nargizi plans to increase her turnover gradually and invest the profits in the same business. 

Nargizi awaits your support.

loans.use: to add stock of merchandise to her grocery store.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is a 58-year-old married man with one grown daughter living with him. The family lives in their old house located in the capital city Tbilisi.  Oleg and his wife are unemployed at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region especially among people over 40.  The only one who earns money in the household is Oleg's daughter who is a choreographer and gets a small monthly salary.

As the existing income is not enough for the family and Oleg can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Oleg applied for the loan at MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor people to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $3000 will help Oleg to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city.  Oleg is very enthusiastic and a hard-working person with a great desire to provide better living conditions for his family members. This loan will be a great support for the family. Oleg is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, sister, two brothers, and parents. George runs a small scale agricultural business, and breeds five pigs and four piglets. He sells livestock in the winter time, and generates a seasonal income. 

Besides George, his brothers generate a small income to the family as well. The elder brother works as an operator at the local petrol station, and the younger is a hired worker at a pig farm.
 
George works hard and wishes to get ahead. He requested a loan from Credo to develop his agricultural business. His loan request was approved within the frames of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. 

With the received credit, George will purchase calves. After purchasing livestock, he will raise them, and after several months they will became dairy cows. The family will produce dairy products for selling and for consumption as well. The new business initiative financed with Kiva's start-up loan will significantly improve George’s living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en:
Oruj is 44 years old and living in the village of Khanjigazlo. He is married and lives with his spouse, grown son, and retired mother in their own house. 

Oruj grows grapes, tomatoes, and red beans. He produces wine with the harvested grapes and sells his production at the local open market. His income from agriculture is seasonal, and Oruj decided to earn a more stable income. 

That’s why Oruj decided to apply for this credit and start a greenhouse business. He is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are offering him.  Thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for greenhouse construction. 

He plans to grow various greens in wintertime and plant tomatoes and cucumbers in summer. He will sell his harvest the whole year and generate income.  Thanks to this loan, he will improve his family's quality of life and increase family funds. Oruj awaits your support.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Bacho

texts.en:
Bacho is 26 years old, married, and from the village of Kvakhchiri. He lives with his wife, infant daughter, retired grandmother, and parents. Bacho and his father are mechanical engineers and work at the local energy company in return for monthly salaries. His mother is employed at the hospital as a nurse, and she earns money as well. 
The family also runs an agricultural business and breeds three milk cows, three calves, and an ox. Bacho's mother produces cheese with the milk and sells it locally. 
Now, Bacho is requesting a loan to purchase chicks to restart a poultry farm. He used to run this business but it was stopped due to financial problems. Part of the credit will be used to buy feed for the chicks. After several months, Bacho will sell chickens for a good price and invest the funds in the next cycle. The family will have an additional source of income from the poultry farming, and they will be able to increase their daily spending. Bacho hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 48 years old. He is single and lives alone in the village of Zhoshkha. The source of income for Gela is his plot of land, where walnut trees and maize are grown. He does all the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good quality harvest. The harvested products are sold locally. So, he has only seasonal income.

He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of a lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

This loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Gela owns a building and plans to set up a grocery store there. With the loan, he will purchase stock for the store like rice, sugar, packaged food, etc. Selling grocery products will positively impact him. This new business initiative will enable Gela to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries for starting a store.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba lives in the village of Patara Oni with his wife. He is 62 years old.

Koba is running an agricultural business for the family. They own five beehives with bee colonies, six pigs and 28 piglets. Koba sells pigs in the wintertime and earns seasonal income. 

He is a very hardworking and experienced farmer who has a great desire to enlarge his farm and generate more income.

He requested credit to purchase sheep. He will start selling lambs in a nearby town's open market as well. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Koba plans to reinvest part of the income in the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start sheep breeding.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is applying for a loan to start up a bakery in his village and bake traditional Georgian bread: shoti. He is a 27-year-old, married and lives with his underage brother, mother and wife. The only one who earns money in the household is George’s mother, who works as a nurse and takes care of old people. Her monthly salary is nearly $120. The family gets small-sized social assistance, as they live below the poverty line. 

In order to generate income, George decided to start this business. He estimates his business will be lucrative, as there is high demand for bread in his village, and he has the proper experience in baking. 

With the received credit, George will renovate the old bakery located in his yard and purchase firewood and flour. George is happy for this startup loan that is offered to poor people for improving their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to renovate the old bakery in his yard and buy firewood and flour.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 40 years old and from the village of Daba Kulashi. She is single and lives with her retired mother, sister and brother-in-law. Shorena’s brother-in-law is the only one earning money in the household, working as a food products distributor locally. His earnings are modest, and the family lives in poverty.

Shorena laments that she is not able to generate income for the family. That is why she has decided to start her own business and purchase clothing and linens for resale. She will sell the items from her house among her community members. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business, and Shorena will be able to continue the business. Shorena believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is unmarried, and her fiancé is a businessman. They have a 9-year-old child who is attending school. 

For the past 10 years, Vivian has been selling palm oil in the local market. She enjoys selling in her business. One thing she loves the most is that she gets more income to enable her to pay her child's tuition. 

Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil. She plans to build a house and buy a car in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil.

loans.name: Lovetee N.

texts.en:
Lovetee N. is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married and has 3 children between the ages of 5-11, and they all attend school.

Lovetee N. has been operating a small food stall for the past four years where she sells red oil.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business; she plans to make her business very big in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a 23-year-old woman who lives in the Paynesville area. She stopped her education at 8th grade and has three children who live at home. Only one is attending school. For 4 years she has been running a table where she sells palm oil and rice. She has a lot of customers and her goods get sold out very two days. Comfort is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil and rice to resell in the local market. She plans to buy land and build a house on it in the near future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and rice to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married to a teacher and has four children between 13 and 18; all of them live alone. For the past 8 years she has been selling used clothes. She learned this business by watching her mother. One of the challenges she faces is that during the rainy season, she makes low profit since customers are very few. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Handful

texts.en:
Handful is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has four children between 1 and 10 years old. All live at home, and three attend school. 

For the last five years she has been selling cold water and oil. She learned this business from her friends. Her main challenge is that during the raining season many customers purchase less.

She requested this loan to enable her to purchase more water by the sack and more oil. In future she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack and more oil.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie is 20 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is unmarried. 

For the past four years she has been selling cold soft drinks. She learned this from her mother. She said her main challenge is when she loses customers. Her favorite part of being in this business is the praises from her customers of how her drinks are always cold. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell. She says in the future she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Korpo B.

texts.en:
Korpo is 48 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has three children between 30 and 16. Only one lives at home and attends school. 

For the past 21 years she has been selling dry goods at her house. She learned this business from her parents. Her main challenge is low purchase of goods during the raining season. 

She has requested this loan to buy more rice, oil, vegetables, etc. In future, she would like to have her own house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has five children, ages 28 to 32. Two are living at home and working. She did not go to school but she has been doing business and helping her children with their school fees. 

For the last six years she has been selling chicken, rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. She started this by helping her mother on the table, so from that point, she learned it. It makes her proud because it helps her to educate her children.

She says her main challenge is lack of enough goods on her business table. She has requested this loan to purchase more of these goods.  In future she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, pepper, oil, vita, etc.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh, 39, lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County. She has a 5-year-old child, who is in school and lives at home. 

For five years now, she has been selling used clothes from a table in the local market. She enjoys how fast her products can be sold. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her dreams are to have a store and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Olive M.

texts.en:
Olive M. lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 28 years old and she is a high school graduate. She is married and has four children, ages 10, 11, 12 and 14, who live at home and attend school. 

For seven years she has been selling rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc. from a table in the local market. She enjoys how her customers buy from her and the profit she makes. One of the problems she faces is small income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc. for her business. In the near future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 26 years old who live at home. Only two attend school. For ten years, she has been running a shop where she sells hinges, nails, door-catches, locks, and other items. One problem she faces is less income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. She is proud of her business because she can pay her children's school fees on time. She is requesting a loan to purchase more hinges, nails, door-catches, locks, and other items for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more hinges, nails, door-catches, locks, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old and lives in West Point. She is married to a commemorator and she has children between the ages of 10 and 30, only one of whom  is currently in school and only two of whom live at home. 

For the past six years she been selling dried fish in the local market. One of her major problems is that she has fewer customers during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish for her business. She hopes to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She did not go to school and has a child 5 years old who is attending school. She has been operating a table where she sells very cold soft drinks. One of her main challenges is she can’t keep up with the demand of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase at least ten crates of soft drinks for her business. In the future she hopes to one day be a wholesale seller and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase at least ten crates of soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: 38-year-old Victoria lives in West Point, she is unmarried and has 6 children between the ages of 6 and 20 years old. All of her children live at home and attend school. For the past six years she has been involved in the sale of oranges and bananas. She learned this business by looking at other women's businesses and her main challenge is the price control. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges and bananas for her business. She hopes to build a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Joetta

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Joetta lives and works in the West Point area; she is married to a local businessman. They have four children between 16 and 24 years old. For the past two years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells tissue, bath and washing soap, Delta soft drink, toothpaste, etc.

What she likes most is that, most of the time, she doesn’t run out of money, and she can use the profit she earns  for her home upkeep. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tissue, bath and washing soap, Delta, toothpaste, etc. She hopes to own her own house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more tissue, bath and washing soap, Delta soft drink, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of seven months and fifteen years.  She began her business because she wanted to generate her permanent source of income. In 2008, Isatu established her slippers business.  She works at her business 7 days per week and 12 hours per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu requested a loan in order to purchase different types of rubber slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest clothing shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of rubber slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Magadi

texts.en:
Magadi is 30 years old and married with four children. She runs a slippers business in Waterloo2, Sierra Leone. She has three additional dependents at home.

Magadi sells slippers within her community.  She's been in this business since 2011.  She says that the main problem to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Magadi requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase a variety of slippers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of slippers for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2, Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are attending school. 

Aminata runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, onions and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking item like rice, onions and cooking season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: 40 year old Martha lives in the West Point area.  She did not go to school.  She is single and has three children ages 10, 15, and 25 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past 5 years, she has been involved in selling rice and soup, cold water, and soft drinks. Her main challenge is the large amount of competition in her community but her business is going well. Martha has requested this loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, meat and soft drinks. In the future, she would like to buy some land and build a good restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, meat and soft drinks

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 44 years old and lives in the West Point community which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is married with four children. She completed 12th grade before opening her business selling water by sack. She manages her business very well. These goods have being sold for the past five years without encountering any problem. Her mother assisted with some funds which she used to start her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more water by sack for her business.

loans.use: to buy more water by sack for her business

loans.name: Mot.praise

texts.en: Mot-Praise lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 33 years old, a high school graduate, and she is married with three children, ages 2, 10, and 17, who are in school and live at home. For the past year, she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita and other items. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting her 3rd loan to purchase additional stock and other items to expand her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to expand her food shop business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 31-year-old, single mother living in West Point, Liberia. She has three children between the ages of 1 and 12. They are not attending school due to lack of financial support. Victoria now sells rice and soup in the local market. Victoria makes a profit with each sale that she uses to buy more goods and to address the needs of her children. She is requesting her 3rd loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more rice, pig feet, fish, pepper, and other items for the business. Her future plan is to educate her children and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more food stocks for her rice and soup selling business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 25 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children ages 2 and 6 years old; they both live with her and only the older one is attending school. For four years now she has been selling bread and soft drinks. She sells from morning hours to evening hours every day. She enjoys having her own money. She has requested a loan to purchase more bread and soft drinks. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and completed grade 2. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells palm oil. She sells six day in a week from 7 AM to 5 PM. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
38-year-old Hawa lives in West Point. She’s married with 6 children. Her first child is three and the last child is twenty-four. They all stay at home with their parents. Hawa has been making and selling "iron soap" for the past nineteen years. She enjoys doing this business because she uses the profit to send her children to school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase caustic soda and palm oil for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa is 37 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has 4 children from 6 to 15 years old. They are in school and they all live with her.  For two years she has selling on a table in the local market where she sells door locks, hinges, nails, etc. Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money and sometimes it's very slow. She started selling for her mother and later decided to sell on her own. 

This is the third time she is requesting a loan and she plans to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has three children aged 3, 10, and 22. Only the two youngest live with her and are attending school. She sells rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. in the local market; she has been doing this for 10 years. She is going to buy additional rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. for her business. She says sometimes the business is very good and she has good profits and sometimes it's slow and she doesn't make any money. She likes having customers around. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en: Maina is 29 years old and lives at West Point which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has three children ages 2, 7, and 10. They are presently in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past ten years she has been selling soap in the local market, and she sells six days in a week from 8am to 9pm; she likes her business because it is a fast going business. She started in business by selling rice. She used a taxi to buy her stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business; she plans to build a house. She says thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo2,in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. 

In 2010, Memunatu established her vendor business. She works at the business from 8am to 12 pm, 7 days per week. She began her business because she wants to be independent. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Memunatu requires a loan to purchase more items like drinks, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like drinks, biscuits, juice, and pure water.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is out of a job so she has to take care of her family alone.
