Nubia, 34, is married with three children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s been in business for herself six years.  She sells seasonal fruit.  She’s currently selling rambutan fruit (a citrus) also called lychee.  She’s a street vendor alongside the highway.

She’s requested her third loan for 5,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more rambuan or lychees to sell and increase sales.  Her goal is to finish building her house and to provide her children with better education.

loans.use: to buy more lychees to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Doña Celia, tiene 51 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en unión con su esposo en el municipio de Choloma Cortes. Ella lleva muchos  años vendiendo cosmeticos como lociones,cremas,desodorantes,tratamientos para el cabello etc. Tambien vende ropa de segunda como blusas, pantalones, camisetas y por encargo tambien tamales, vende en casa y ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 4,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas cosméticos como ser lociones, cremas, maquillajes, tratamientos para el cabello, ropa como ser blusas, jeans, faldas, short y otros. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el inventario para así obtener un aumento en las ventas. Su meta es que su negocio  pueda crecer, mejorar su vivienda y sus hijos puedan tener una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Celia, 51, has three children and lives in a free union with her husband in the town of Choloma Cortes. She has been selling cosmetics like lotions, creams, deodorants, and hair products for many years. She also sells second-hand clothing such as blouses, pants, and shirts and tamales to order from her house and on the street. 

She has applied for a loan of 4,000 lempiras to buy cosmetics like lotions, creams, makeup, and hair treatments and clothing such as skirts, shorts, blouses, and jeans. The loan will allow her to buy more inventory to increase sales. Her goal is to grow her business, renovate her house, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like lotions, creams, makeup, and treatments and clothing such as skirts, shorts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Berta Lidia

texts.es: Berta, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio para obtener sus propios ingresos, lleva 15 años de comprar y vender cosméticos como cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, aretes etc. y mercadería en general. Su negocio lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de dos prestamos anteriores y la reinversión de sus ganancias. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos como desodorantes, cremas, lociones, maquillajes y otros como aretes  para tener surtido el negocio. Su propósito es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Berta, 39, is a single mother of three children. She lives in the Choloma, Cortes municipality. 

She has always worked in commerce to earn her own income. She has been buying and selling cosmetics such as creams, lotions, deodorants, make up, earrings etc for the past 15 years. 

She has maintained her business through two previous loans and by reinvesting her profits. 

She is currently requesting a loan of $500 [10,000 HNL] which she will invest it to buy more products such as deodorants, creams, lotions, make up and other items such as earrings in order to have stock. 

Her proposal is to increase sales and profits in order to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy more products such as deodorants, creams, lotions, make up and other items such as earrings in order to have stock.

loans.name: Rocio Carolina

texts.es: Rocío, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. En busca de obtener mas ingresos para su hogar hace 3 años que decidió vender ropa interior para damas, blusas, camisetas y sandalias. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante con entrega a domicilio. Rocío a solicitado tres ciclos de prestamos con el actual para su negocio, este préstamo es por  2,500 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa interior como blúmer, sostén, boxes etc. para la venta y asi podrá mejorar sus ventas. Su plan es mantener el negocio surtido y con las ganancias poder ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rocío, 35, is married with three children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Seeking to earn additional household income she decided to start women’s underwear, blouses, t-shirts and sandals three years ago.  She does this at home and from place to place providing home delivery.

Rocío has requested three loan cycles including this one for her business.  This one is for 2,500 Lempiras she’ll use to buy underwear like panties, bras, boxer shorts, etc. to sell and improve her sales.  Her plan is to keep the business stocked and to use profits to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es: Don Bartolo, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en un barrio del municipio de Puerto Cortes junto a dos de sus hijos y su esposa. Don Bartolo tiene su propio negocio desde hace 6 años el vende variedad de ropa usada como blusas, pantalones, camisas, short y otras. También vende frutas como naranjas, bananos y frutas de temporada, pone su venta a orilla de la calle frente a su casa. El realiza otra actividad de hacer fletes o acarreo donde recibe otros ingresos. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para su actividad de negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 21,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para surtir de ropa usada para vender en esta  temporada y arreglar su vehiculo donde hace fletes. Su plan es que el negocio siga en crecimiento para poder ayudar  a su familia.
texts.en: Bartolo is 65 years old. He has three children, and he lives in a neighborhood of the muncipality of Puerto Cortes, together with his wife and two of his children. Bartolo has had his own business for 6 years. He sells a variety of used clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and other items. He also sells fruit, such as oranges, bananas and seasonal fruits. He sets up his sales stand at the edge of the road in front of his house. He also does other work, making deliveries or transporting loads, which provides him with additional income. He has obtained various loans for his business. Currently he is requesting another one for 21,000 Lempiras, which he will use to buy a variety of used clothing to sell during this season, and also to repair his delivery vehicle. His plan is to continue expanding his business so he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of used clothing to sell (blouses, pants, shirts, etc.) and to repair his delivery vehicle.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Raquel  lleva 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, champú, aretes, cadenas, pulseras etc. Ademas vende churros, dulces y otras golosinas. La venta de cosmeticos las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos de catálogos de productos Arabela y otros. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el tercer ciclo con la institución, con el cual va para comprar cosméticos que le han pedido los clientes como lociones, cremas, champú, aretes, cadenas, pulseras y va comprar productos como churros, dulces, golosinas, pan, granos básicos y otros. Su idea es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar educación a sus hijos y  mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Raquel is 32 and a single mother to four children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida. For four years, Raquel has been selling cosmetics, creams, deodorants, shampoo, earrings, chains, bracelets etc. She also sells churros and sweets. She sells her products door to door, through mail order catalogues such as Arabela and others. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras, her third loan with the organisation, which she will use to buy the cosmetics her customers have ordered, as well as items such as churros, sweets, bread, basic grains and more. Her plan is to grow her business and increase her earnings, in order to be able to educate her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the cosmetics her customers have ordered, including lotions, creams, shampoo, earrings, chains and bracelets, as well as churros, sweets, bread and basic grains and other items to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 44 years old and she is married with four children. She sells self-made juice in town, and the business has been growing. She started the business four years ago from her own personal savings. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy fruits and plastic bottles for juice production and packaging. 

She hopes that in next five years, she will diversify her business into agriculture. She wants to do poultry farming. The challenges that she faces are frequent electricity blackouts and the lack of a sealing machine. She will use the extra income that she will raise to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fruits and plastic bottles for juice production and packaging.

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is 52 years old, and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with five children. Her business for the past eight years has been buying and selling scrap metal. The business has grown over the years, and she has been able to employ three people to help her run the business. She also does farming when not at the business site. 

She hopes that the business will grow into a stable company to generate income for her. She knew Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan to buy more scrap metal for sale. The challenges that she faces in the business include transportation costs that are high and price changes. She will use the income raised to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 50 years old and he lives in the Kaloleni area, which is near to Mariakani, Kenya. He is married with five children. He started the business out of his own savings and the business has grown into a retail shop. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil for sale in his business. He hopes that the business will grow into being a wholesale business in the next five years despite the price changes, inflation, and high fuel costs. He will buy a piece of land with the extra income that he will raise from the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is happy to have receive her first Kiva loan because she was able to improve her business. She repaid the loan without challenges. 

Her small grocery store improved and her standard of living improved as well.  She has a tailoring business that she started from a previous loan and the business is growing very well. 

Philomena now seeks a loan to buy cloth material for her business. She has a long term ambition of opening a tailoring training business in the next five years, despite the challenges of bad debts and competition. 

Philomena will use the income to pay school fees for her children and to improve her savings.

loans.use: to buy cloth material.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella se ha dedicado al comercio para la manutención de sus hijos. Hace 5 años que tiene un negocio de una abarrotería donde ofrece productos enlatados, harina, azúcar, jabón, frijoles, maíz, dulce, refrescos, lácteos, frutas, verduras, churros, golosinas, etc. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va  comprar más productos como azúcar, granos básicos, refrescos, productos lácteos, verduras y frutas para  satisfacer la demanda del cliente y así poder mantener su negocio muy surtido. Su meta es hacer más grande su negocio y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and is a single mom with two children.  She lives in Arizona, Atlantida and works to support her children.  For the past five years she has had a grocery store where she sells canned goods, flour, sugar, soap, beans, rice, candy, soft drinks, dairy products, fruit, vegetables, chips, snacks, etc.  

The loan she is requesting is the second cycle and is for 8,000 Lempiras with which she will buy more products such as sugar, staple grains, soft drinks, dairy products, vegetables and fruits to satisfy the demand of her customers and keep her business running with a good assortment of products. Her goal is to increase her sales and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more products such as sugar, staple grains, soft drinks, dairy products, vegetables and fruits to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es: Jose, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Toda la vida el se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, lleva 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café además del maíz y frijol. El café que produce lo vende en grano en el mercado local.  Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para poder abonar y darle un mejor mantenimiento a la finca. Su meta es poder obtener  buenos ingresos económicos del café para brindarle una mejor vida a toda su familia.
texts.en: José, who is 44 years old, is married, has four children, and lives in the town of Gracias Lempira. All his life he has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. Besides corn and beans, he has 20 years of experience in growing coffee. He sells the coffee that he produces in the local market as whole beans. He has applied for a second loan of 12,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of fertilizer so that he can fertilize his fields and maintain them better. His goal is to be able to obtain good income from coffee in order to offer a better life to all his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in the Mariakani area near Mombasa Kenya. She is a 44-year-old widowed mother of five. She owns some property that she intends to develop. She also has a food cafe and charcoal business that she has done for years now. She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to buy cement, sand, wooden doors, and windows to build some rental houses. She will use the income that she will raise to pay the school fees for her children. She hopes that in the coming years she will own a stream of real estate despite the challenges of rent not being paid in time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wooden doors, and windows

loans.name: Gralphine

texts.en:
Gralphine lives in Likoni, south of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 27 years old and married, with a child. 

She has been running a retail shop for the past three years in her neighborhood, and the business has been doing great. In most cases, she sells household items. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy flour, salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.  

She has great ambition that in the next five years, she will be running a wholesale business despite the challenges of bad debts and price changes. 

She will use the increase in income to improve the standard of living for her young family.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus lives in Kongowea area in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 40-year-old husband and father of three. All of his children attend school. He owns a retail business that he started one year ago. The business has been growing ever since, and now he feels it is the right time to expand his operations. He found out about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy stocks of flour, sugar, and salt for sale in his business. He has a vision of owning a wholesale business in the future, despite the usual challenge of competition. He will use the extra income that he will raise to educate his children and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy retail stocks of flour, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 29 years old and married, with an 8-month-old baby. 

Veronica owns a small grocery store that has been in operation for the past two years. She hopes that in the next five years she will graduate to be a supplier. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for the business. 

The challenge in the business is transportation costs that are high. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 35-year-old married business lady with three children. She runs a small food cafe in town that has been in operation for the last six months. The business has grown and she has employed five people to help her run the business. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and fuel. She hopes that the business will expand over the next five years into a reputable restaurant in town despite the challenge of still completing and the high food prices. She will use the income that she earns to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and fuel.

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en: Jairus lives in the Kaloleni area near Mariakani, Kenya. He is 54 years of age, married with five children. He owns a fish selling business in the local centre, a business he started three years ago. He also owns some property with rental houses. He started the business from money he got from rent and the business is really growing. He knew about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy fresh fish to sell. He has a long term ambition to own a transportation vehicle to cut the transportation costs. The challenge in the business is high fuel and transportation costs. He will use the income raised to pay school fees for his children who are still in school.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is happy that she was able to get her first Kiva loan and she was able to improve her business. She was able to start an electronics business that has been growing now. She seeks a loan to buy electrical products for sale in the business. She wants to be operating a wholesale business alongside the retail one in the next five years despite the challenge of capital. The income she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy electrical products.

loans.name: Chanthan's Group

texts.en: A local farmer residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chanthan is a young 24-year-old mother of two little kids. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice farming, which she has done for five years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is the leader of a group consisting of three female members. She and one of her co-borrowers are second-time borrowers whereas the remaining one is a third-time borrower.  As the leader, Chanthan, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can triple her crop output so that she can improve her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Earm's Group

texts.en: Earm is 26 years old and a mother of one little kid. The rest of her family is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where she does has pig-raising business.  She has been involved in the current business since she was 20 years old.  She has never had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She and the other three borrowers have teamed up in a group of four to get their first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs to prevent disease. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily so as to sell for a good price and make more income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs to prevent disease

loans.name: Lyhorn's Group

texts.en:
Lyhorn is 29 and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Srey Snom district in Cambodia.  To feed the family, Lyhorn and her husband earn a living as farmers.  They have been farming rice and selling grocery items for 11 years, earning about 44,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

This is Lyhorn’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has three members, who are just with VisionFund for this cycle.  As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund.  Lyhorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields in order to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sreythach's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sreythach is a 26-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for three years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day.

Sreythach is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreythach will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Udom

texts.en:
Udom is 21 years old and a rural villager residing in Steong Meanchey district of Kandal Province. To overcome the daily financial burdens in his family, he has been working as a security guard for two years. The current business earns him about 4 USD per day to meet the family's needs.

This is the first microloan for Udom with VisionFund. Now he is asking for an education loan to pay for his university tuition fee for four years, specializing in Computer​​​​ Science. She hopes this loan will help him to learn a special skill for a long-term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fee.

loans.name: Minea's Group

texts.en:
A local villager from Battambang province, Minea is 26 years old and blessed with two children. Currently, she can earn about 38,000 KHR per day from her rice cropping business that she has been engaged in for several years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in a second cycle loan, whereas her co-borrower is in her first cycle. She has smartly used her loan in order to uplift her living condition better than before. 

Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in Kilifi, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 23-year-old single business lady. She sells clothes, and she has been in the business for the last two and a half years. She started the business from her own savings she had made over time. The business has been growing ever since, and she finds this a perfect opportunity to expand it. 

She knew of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy women’s tops and inner wear for sale. She hopes that in the next five years, she will be running a boutique despite the challenges of bad debts. The income she raises will be re-invested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy women's tops and inner wear.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 28, lives in Kongowea, a suburb in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with one child. She runs a beauty salon in Mtwapa that has been in existence for the last year. She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy wigs, weaves, and other cosmetics for her salon.

She hopes that in the next five years the business will have grown, and she wishes to open other branches of the business. The challenge in the business is competition from other service providers. She will use the income that she will raise to educate her child and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wigs, weaves, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 41 years old and is married with eight children. He sells water, and he has been involved in this business for the last twelve years. 

The business has grown and he has been able to employ two people to help him run it. He found out about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy a water tank for his business.  He hopes that in the next five years he will have increased the water points. The major challenges that he faces in the business are water shortages and weather. He will use the income raised to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his water selling business.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is a citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district.  She is 53 years old and married. She has seven children. 

To feed her family, she and her husband have worked hard as fishermen for 20 years. The current business earns them about KHR 29,000 per day. 

Ly’s group consists of two members. She has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her living. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a boat for supporting her catching fish. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a boat for supporting her catching fish

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Residing in the Trang district of Takeo province, Lay is 38 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom still counts on her and is still at school. She has struggled to make a living by working as a rice farmer while her husband is a palm juice maker. She and her husband have engaged in this business for 22 years and are able to earn up to 11 US dollars per day. However, she is able to save only 2 US dollars per day after deducting all of her expenses. 

Lay has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as the first-time borrower with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to pay for her son’s tuition fees at the local university. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue a degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees at the local university

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom, a rural villager from Takeo province's Bati district where silk weaving is a popular business in the neighborhood, is 46 years old and she has three children, one of whom is still in school. Yom is a silk weaver while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Having engaged in this business for 10 years, Yom is able to save up to 9 US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses.

This is the first-cycle loan for Yom with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter, an 18-year-old freshman in a local university specializing in Accounting. She sincerely hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and also help her daughter to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

loans.name: Hokheang

texts.en:
A married mother of five children living in the Sandan district of Kampong Thom province, Hokheang plants rice and grows cassava. To supplement this income, she also sells grocery items. The current business earns her about US$14 per day to meet her family’s need.
Hokheang joins Kiva's partner VisionFund this cycle as a second-time borrower. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve financial burden for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is aged 39 years old and married. He is a father of two dependent children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice, selling grocery items for 11 years.
Sambath’s group consists of two male members who live in the same village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. He is the fourth cycled client with VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Sambath, who is the leader, will user his portion to buy more grocery items to resale. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district, Saran is a 39-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are in school. The main source of the family’s income is from raising chickens and ducks, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Saran is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the fourth loan for Saran’s group of two members. They successfully paid back the previous loan with VisionFund. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy chicken and duck feed. She hopes to fatten her chickens and ducks so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy chicken and duck feed.

loans.name: Sokhoeurb

texts.en: Sokhoeurb is a mother of six children and is in her 60s. She is a resident from the Bovel district of the Battambang province. Nowadays, she deals with the daily cost of her living via rice farming and an orange plantation with which she has engaged for several years. Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) at least five cycles, Sokhoeurb has utilized her past loans wisely to maintain her business as well as her lifestyle. For this cycle, she applies for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for weeding and plowing fees for her crop. She does believe that she keeps improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay weeding and plowing fees for her crop.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Rith is a local farmer who grows maize and rice as the main source of income to support her five children. 

She has engaged in her current business for four years. Her prior loan was the first microloan for Rith with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Rith repaid her past loan with success, and it enabled her to stabilize her living condition.  

She is applying for a new loan to buy insecticide for her crop and to pay plowing fees. 

She hopes that she can gain a triple yield from her crop so she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for her crop and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en:
Srean, 30, is one breadwinner in the family, consisting of four schoolchildren. For the sake of her kids, she manages cassava farming as a single business to generate a decent income to overcome her family’s hardship. 

Involved in her current business for ages, she is able to earn about 28,300 KHR per day. This is the sixth loan for Srean and the third loan for her co-borrower in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the past successful loan that she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can support her living and keep her kids in school. 

Now, she is seeking 500,000 KHR, whereas her joint member is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan in order to pay for the plowing fee, to buy fertilizer, and to buy insecticide for her crop. She does believe that she can gain a good income from her crop.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, buy fertilizer, and buy insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Sophoeurn's Group

texts.en: Sophoeurn is 29 years old and married father of three kids. He has only a single business, rice farming, to support his living especially the daily food consumption in his household. Engaging in his business for several years, he is able to generate about 30,800 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Sophoeurn with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). He is forming a group of three to get this first loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crop. He highly believes that he can gain a good yield from his crop so as he can expand his business better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Age 29 and a resident from Kampong Cham province, Sokly is married and blessed with two children. She struggles to make a living via rice farming, and her husband's occupation is working at a construction site.

Sokly has been involved in her current business for 11 years. This is the first microloan for Sokly with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) in order to buy fertilizer, and also to buy a small plot of farmland to expand her agriculture business. Additionally, she will buy piglets for raising as extra income.

She hopes that she can gain a good income from both of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to also buy a small plot of farmland to expand her agriculture business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en: Seyha is 40 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Her main sources of income are from her room rental fees, her husband's occupation as a government officer, and her husband's extra job as a motor taxi driver.  This is the third loan for Seyha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid the past loans with success to improve her living conditions so they are better than they were before. For this cycle, she wants to focus on the tertiary education of her child. Hence, she is seeking an education loan to pay for the tuition fee for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en: A rural villager from Ksach Kandal province, Bunthy is 46 years old and married. She is blessed with four children who still rely on her as they are in school. To meet her family's needs, Bunthy grows rice as her main source of income while her husband works in construction. She has been in her current business for several years and earns almost $7.50 per day. She is requesting her fifth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) after repaying her first four. The positive impact of her loans has allowed her to provide a decent life to her children and keep them in school. She is requesting a new loan to pay her daughter's tuition so she can get a bachelor's degree in accounting. She hopes that this financial support will allow her daughter to pay more attention to her studies and get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Samang

texts.en:
SamAng is 37 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. She tackles her family’s hardship via rice farming and working at a local factory. 

To help her earn additional income, her husband sells palm fruit during his spare time.  She has been in business since she was 20 years old.  Sam Ang, who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for one past loan cycle, is applying for a new loan as a second-time borrower. 

SamAng will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop.  She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop yield better than before and return her a good income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
Noeurn is 51 years old and has three children. Nowadays, only two children are in school.

She does rice farming and sews palm leaf for resale; normally rural villagers will use this product to cover their house as a roof.  These businesses generate about 8,500 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Noeurn and her friend are first-time borrowers. Noeurn, is the group's leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family.  She hopes that she does not need to worry about illnesses caused by the lack of sanitation practices, so she can work to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Sombok

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Thom province, Sombok is 46 years old and blessed with two children. To strive for a living, she sells beef as her main source of income. This is the second loan for Sombok with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she repaid completely has enabled her to keep her kids in school. Now, she is applying for an education loan with VisionFund in order to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Sophay

texts.en:
Sophay is 44 years old and a married mother of three children. Sophay struggles for a living; she does rice farming, and raises pigs as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for more than 20 years. 

This is the first loan for Sophay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to cover the school fee for her son, who wants to pursue an associate bachelor degree, majoring in Nursing. 

She hopes this loan will help her son fulfill his dream.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her son.

loans.name: Sareon

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Sa Ang village of Kandal province, Sareon is 55-year-old and married with seven children. To make a living, Sareon has been farming rice, while her husband is a fisherman. She and her husband are able to earn $12 per day to support the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Sareon with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. Sareon will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Aged 47 years, Phally is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice, which she has been doing for almost 30 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 25,000 per day from the current business and are able to save about KHR 13,000 each day for the future. 

This is the second loan for Phally with VisionFund. She used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, Phally is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production and better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sophoun's Group

texts.en:
Sophoun lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 26 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school in the local area. To support the family, she has been farming rice for ten years and she can earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is Sophoun’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Sophoun will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Khean

texts.en: Khean, age 50 and a widow, is a resident from Bateay Meanchey province where she does her business to generate a decent income for her family. She has three children, two of whom still rely on her. One of her dependent children is studying in local university and the other is helping her business. As a single mother, she does rice farming and selling some grocery items at home. This business that she has occupied for 8 years has returned her about USD3 per day with USD 1.5 for saving after deducting necessary expenses. Never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before, Khean is applying for an education loan in order to pay for the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue bachelor degree majoring in Engineering. She hopes that she can support her son’s education on time.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee for her son

location.town: Banteay Meanchey province, Thmor Pouk district

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Vy is the 50-year-old mother of seven children, six of whom are dependents. She is a rice farmer in the local area. Having been in the business for twenty years, she can make her daily income from her current business of 23,000 KHR and is able to save about 13,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the fourth microloan for Vy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to make a better living .

loans.use: to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthea's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 29, is a married woman living with her family in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for eight years, Chanthea is able to earn about 46,000 KHR (Cambodia Riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Chantha has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Young's Group

texts.en:
Young, 57, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on three hectares of farmland for the past 10 years. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future. 
Young’s group of four have been members of VisionFund for one cycle already, and they completely paid back the loan. Young wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve her family’s financial burden and afford to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, she is leading her group in applying for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Ran is 56 years old and married. She has ten children. To support her big family, she and her husband have been farming for several years. Their current business earns her family about 32,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 
Ran has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle already, and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy is 34 years old, and she lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has eight dependent children; three are in school, while another two are too young for school. To make a living, she has been growing rice for several years. She and her husband can earn about 57,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Navy is a second cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Navy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to produce more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en: Seng is 56 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has four dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 20 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for her future needs.  This is the third micro loan for Seng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Seng will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pork's Group

texts.en:
Pork, 44, lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Pork earns a living through working in a local garment factory while her husband is a fisherman. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and can manage to save about 3,000 KHR each day after spending on daily expenses. 

This is Pork’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has only six members, and she has been with them for two loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund and she has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Pork is going to use her portion to buy materials to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine that her family can use.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea, 29, is married with three dependent children, two of whom are in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on one-hectare of farmland. She has been running her business for 11 years, earning about KHR 44,000 per day.
Kea is a client with VisionFund and is requesting a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields thus earning more income to increase her standard of living and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is aged 30 and married. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. Living in a village of the Cheung Prey district, Chanthy farms rice to make a living. Having been in this business for 12 years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children. 

This is the first loan for Chanthy with VisionFund. She is now forming her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chanthy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean is a citizen from a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kandal Steong district, where crop farming is a common business to make a living. He is married and is the 60-year-old father of four children. One of his children is in school. To feed his household, he earns a living through farming rice. He is able to earn up to US$18 per day from this business in which he has been working for 20 years, and he can manage to save only US$9 each day for future needs.

Mean, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking his first loan. He is going to use this loan for his son's education by paying the tuition fees for the four years of his son’s bachelor degree. This loan will enable him to send his son to university and to keep him there.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for the four years of his son’s bachelor degree.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Yem is 46 years old and a resident of Steung Meanchey District. She sells snacks and rice in the local area while her husband is a security guard. Yem and her husband have been involved in this business and job for three years which brings them about US$28 per day but they can save about US$8 each day after daily expenses. 

Yem is the first cycled client with VisionFund. For this new loan cycle, she is applying for an education loan to pay her daughters' tuition fees to study finance and banking. She hopes that her daughters will have special skills and will be able to make a long-term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' tuition fees to study finance and banking.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 48 years old and a rural villager residing in Trang district of Takeo Province. She has five children, two of whom are students. To overcome the daily financial burden in the family, she farms rice while her husband is a teacher. Touch and her husband are able to earn about US$12 per day to support her family.

Touch has been with VisionFund for the past three cycles and she has completely repaid back with success. The subsequent loans have enabled her to maintain her living conditions. She is now applying for a loan to pay the tuition fees for her daughter's four-year university bachelor's degree. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after the graduation.

loans.use: to spend on tuition fees for her daughter’s university.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Residing in the Samrong District of Takeo Province, Sophat is 39 years old and married. She has three sons, two of whom are still in school. Sophat and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years. To supplement their income, she also buys and sells chicken while her husband works as a paid construction worker. Sophat has been engaged in her business for 10 years and is able to earn up to US$45 per day. However, she is able to save only US$5 per day after deducting all related expenses. 

Sophat has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for four cycles. Now, she is applying as a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund for an education loan to pay for her son's university fees. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue his degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son's university fees.

loans.name: Sron

texts.en:
A married mother of four children living in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Sron does cassava-growing and supplements her income by buying and selling cassava in her village. She has four children, all of whom are still in school. Sron has been engaged in these businesses for 20 years. 

Sron joins VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en: Doung is a widowed mother of three children in her 60s. She is a local farmer who does rice farming as the main source of her income. This business has returned her about 8,300 KHR per day. After deducting the necessary expenses, she is able to save up to 2,600 KHR per day. She has never had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is part of a group of three requesting 170,000 KHR each to get latrine loans. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this purchase will help her family to prevent relevant illness related to the lack of sanitation.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 35, is a mother of three children. She deals with her family’s financial burden via rice farming which has generated her about 8,600 KHR per day. 

Pheap has never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before. Now, she has formed a group of three to get a new loan of 170,000 KHR each. She is the leader and will use her entire portion to build a proper latrine for her kids to promote a hygienic practice in her family.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine for her kids

loans.name: Bunly's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Bunly is 45 years old and a father of four kids. For his family, rice farming is the single business which generates about 9,300 KHR per day to support his living.  Bunly is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has joined a group of three to get a new loan. He is the leader and will utilize his loan to build a proper latrine for his household. He hopes that he can own a decent latrine to improve sanitation practices in his family.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine

loans.name: Phorng

texts.en:
Phorng is 60 years old and a married mother of one child, residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province. 

To struggle for a living, Phorng does rice and maize farming as the main sources of income. She has been involved in the current business for ten years. 

Including this loan, Phorng is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in completely repaying the past loan and this loan has improved her lifestyle, better than before. 

Now, Phorng is seeking a new loan of KHR 4,000,000 in order to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield from her crops, so that she can double her income, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurn is a married 28-year-old mother. She is blessed with two little children. To cover the daily cost of living, she grows pineapple as the main source of income; it is a business that she has been involved in for several years, and it has returned her about 31,000 Riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the first loan for Khoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has formed a group of two to get a new loan, and is the group leader. She will spend her portion on potash for her crop. She highly believes that she can boost her crop yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Nai is 60 years old and a married father of six children. Currently, only two kids are in school. For the sake of his kids, he manages a rice farming business, and pig and cricket-raising businesses. Nai has been involved in his current businesses for 12 years, earning about USD 2 per day.  

This is the first loan for Nai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to cover the tuition fee for his two children who want to hold a Bachelor's degree; his daughter prefers Accounting as her major and his son prefers studying Mechanics. He hopes that he can grant his children’s dream via this financial support.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fees for his two children

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is a villager from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 22 years old and married. To add to the family income, she does paddy rice farming and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for five years, earning about 24,000 KHR per day. 

Sreymom, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, is getting her first loan in order to pay her school fees. She wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in English literature. She hopes to get good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay her school fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 42 years old and married. She has three kids, residing in Takeo province. Nowadays, she needs to support two children as they are in school.  To earn a living, she manages two hectares of rice farming whereas her husband can earn extra income via working as a school teacher. 

Engaging in her current business for 22 years, she is able to generate for almost USD7 per day. Sokhom is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a new loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree in Law. She hopes her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Tonin

texts.en:
Tonin is 43 years old and a married mother blessed with four children who are in school. For the sake of her kids, she makes a living via running a small grocery shop at home and provides photocopy service in the area. To assist her in earning a proper income, her husband drives a "tricycle" motorbike for a fee.  She has just been involved in her current business for two years. 

Tonin, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan, has fully repaid her past loan and the positive impact of this loan has supported her business in a timely manner and kept her kids in school. Now, she  wants to support her daughter who wants to hold a Bachelor's degree, majoring in International Relations. Thus, she is applying for this education loan from VisionFund to cover the school fees for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is 34 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hard-working man who strives to offer his family a good life. 

He has been operating a home appliances business for more than five years. He started his business from his personal capital. It is the main source of his income. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So he took a loan of YER 200,000 from AMB to stock his business with more home appliance products so his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his business with more home appliances.

loans.name: Al-Twhid Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Twhid. It consists of three ladies. All of them are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. They are hard working and professional in their business. Sumia is the leader of this group. She is a 31-year-old married woman and has two children who live inSana'a, Yemen. She is a housewife who does her best to raise her children well. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family. Her refrigerator is not working and she does not have enough money to buy another one. She applied for a loan of YER 30,000 from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her house. She hopes to run a store to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Al-Sabah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sabah. It consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Sabah, age 49, has children. She sells incense and perfumes to earn a living and she has been operating her business for four years. She started her business to provide for her children's needs. 

She has applied for a loan in the amount of YER 60,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB), which she will use to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale. This loan will improve her business income and will help improve her family's living standards. 

Eventually, she hopes to own a store where she can sell incense, perfumes, and cosmetic materials.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Noha Group

texts.en:
The members of the "Noha" group are four women. They all live in traditional extended families in Hodeidah, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). 

Hamda is a leader of the group and is 32 years old. She has been selling clothes, incense, and perfumes for four years. She started her business with a small amount. She says that she does well with the business. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business. She hopes the business will continue growing as it's done to date and hopes to open a clothing store. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Sama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sama, and it consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Haind is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of them in school. She is a housewife who wants her children to grow up well and have a better education. She intends to buy supplies for her house and hopes to live comfortably with her family. 

She is applying for a loan of YER 30,000 from AMB to buy a fridge to use in her house. The importance of this loan is that it will give her the opportunity to keep her food and juices cold. 

She hopes to improve her living standards and have a better education for her children

loans.use: to buy a fridge to use for her house.

loans.name: Moain Group

texts.en:
This group is called Moain. It consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking members who provide for their families. 

This group applied for a loan of 150,000 YER (Yemen rials). Amal is 30 years old and the leader of this group. She is a married woman and has three children. She is a housewife who wants her children to grow up well and have a better education. 

With this loan, she intends to buy supplies for her house so that she can live comfortably with her family. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances to use for her house. She hopes to improve her living conditions. The two children who appear in the photo are the children of a member of this group.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use for her house.

loans.name: Al-Shohra Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Shohra Group, which consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a combined loan of 310,000 YER from AMB to support different types of businesses. Group member Haya works hard to offer a good life for her family. She is 39 years old and is a bread-winner for her family, selling mobile recharge cards door-to-door for the last three years. She is an affectionate member of this group and she is very happy with her efforts to improve her business. She loves her work and aspires to continue it to improve her business. She therefore applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy more mobile recharge cards to sell to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy more mobile recharge cards for sale to earn more profit.

loans.name: Thakriat Group

texts.en: This loan group is called Thakriat. They live in Aden, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB, Kiva's field partner. Alof is 33 years old and lives with her family in Aden, Yemen. She sells phone recharge cards. She started her business one and half years ago and enjoys the retail trade. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the acquisition of more phone recharge cards to sell. This loan will help her make a new investment so that she can generate more income and keep her customers satisfied. Her aspiration is to excel in her trade and to have her own call center in a location where there is more customer traffic. This would allow her to be closer to her family and have more stable living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing more phone recharge cards to sell.

loans.name: Radhia Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called Radhia and consists of three ladies: Radhia, Mriam and Fawziah. 

Radhia is the leader of this group. She lives in Aden, Yemen and for many years has made her living selling clothing and perfumes. She has decided to expand her business because she sees the move as profitable. So, Radhia is requesting 60,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB, Kiva's field partner, to buy clothing, sweets and perfumes. She says that this loan, her second, will be of help because she will be able to buy varied merchandise. This will increase her sales while generating greater earnings at the same time. 

Radhia saw direct benefits from the first loan, which enabled a happier life for her children. She thanks Kiva lenders for funding her first loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sweets and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Samrach

texts.en:
Samrach, a young single man residing in Banteay Meanchey province, is 21 years old and a local farmer who does rice farming on one and half hectares of farmland as his single source of income. This business has generated about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Samrach wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Business Administration. However, the shortage of financial support is his main challenge. To overcome this problem, he is getting a first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to pay tuition fees for his academic study. He hopes that he will find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay school fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 40 years old and blessed with four children. Her main sources of income are her embroidery business and rice farming. This work has helped her earn about 7,000 KHR per day. 

For this loan cycle, Saroeurn wants to pay attention to improving sanitation practices for her family. So she has teamed up with a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, Saroeurn will spend her entire loan portion to construct a proper latrine for her family. She hopes this construction will minimize the risk of illness due to the lack of sanitation.

loans.use: To construct a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
A father in his early 50s residing in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Pok earns a living through rice farming. To help him and bring in additional income, his wife has an embroidery business. Pok's business earns him about 9,300 KHR per day. 

This is Pok's first loan with VisonFund (Kiva’s partner). He has formed a group of two to get this new loan. As the leader of the group, Pok will spend his entire loan portion to construct a proper latrine for his family. He hopes that he can improve sanitation practices in his household.

loans.use: To construct a proper latrine for his family
